Reviews.Title: “Simply disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Arodriguez0223
Reviews.Content: This was suppose to be a romantic getaway weekend instead I spent my weekend keeping my calm. It's true what they say the quality of service can make a difference. Front desk personnel needs to work on their greeting and manners I've worked in the hotel industry before I know that guest staying in the hotels are away from home either business or pleasure and a smile or professionalism can make a huge difference. If people are having a bad day that should not affect your performance at work if it does then stay home. I was very irrate to ask for help with a simple request and be met with attitude I paid 170 only to take my simple request and walk to a near by establishment and resolve it myself. I would not recommend this hotel try it for yourself call in before you stay to confirm and you'll find yourself having to call 2 different numbers or only to have someone on the other end tell you front desk is closed??? I give it just do as you wish people but I did my part of warning you.

Reviews.Title: “Jose Reyna”
Reviews.Author: alma f
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Kyoto Grand Hotel with my family because this trip was a present to my younger daughter for her 15th annyversary. We were efficiently assisted, the hotel's location is excellent because it is near of the principal avenues, the metro stations and the bus stop stations where you can go everywhere. Besides the principal access, the lobby, the art gallery, the elevators, everything is beautiful and comfortable. The staff is very kindly and they are at your service everytime. The inner gardens are the most beautiful places where you can enjoy a private familiar party or celebration. The rooms are so big, spacious and clean. The beds are so comfortable and soft. This hotel is the perfect place where you can find peace and feel relax.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Gaylatte
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and nice location convenient to Union Station, theatres and concer hall and Olivera Street. The staff was very nice and accommodating and we really appreciated the shuttle service that takes you anywhere in the downtown area. The Japanese rooftop garden is lovely. The only negative was a plumbing problem that caused the bathtub to belch up some pretty nasty stuff at one point. This hotel was just acquired by Doubletree and we will definitely go back and hope that the service remains as goo.

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto has too much loud music at night”
Reviews.Author: 1776AJW
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Kyoto many times and like the staff. The rooms are less than average. My last stay was terrible. Loud music from the courtyard (their "Japanese Garden") for a buffet they hosted went from late afternoon well into the night. I tried to turn the TV volume to overcome the noise but no luck. It was just too loud. This hotel is about to be branded as a Hilton Doubletree. When I complained about the loud music the front desk said that the new management group was having a party and the music would go well into the night. They helped with giving me a different room. I contaced the general manager, Joseph Kuhn, with a voice mail and it's been several days without a reply. I highly recommend to avoid this hotel unless you are one of the new management group.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: jpcrash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The service was amazing. I had a lower floor but didn't have any noise related issues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location & amenities”
Reviews.Author: SuisunHampton
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Kyoto Grand Hotel and attended a conference. The hotel is kept in the Japanese theme which is subtle & tasteful. The check-in was fantastic and thorough. The room on the 21st floor offered great views, was clean and well appointed. The food presentation and quality during our conference were both creative & excellent. One of the evening events took place in the Kyoto Gardens which is an amazing "oasis" in the middle of downtown L.A. This Japanese Garden is very pretty, well maintained and clean. The food stations were superb and the sushi was to die for. The Saki tasting station was well visited and educational. Overall I was very impressed by the hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JoeMacsgirl
Reviews.Content: My son graduated from the Southern Califorinia Institute of Architecture and they recommended this hotel for graduation week. It was more than the pictures on line showed. The staff was more than professional, they were curteous and clean; the lounge staff and the restaurant staff were very welcoming and patient. The rooms were clean and very quiet. The bed was so comfortable I wanted to bring it home. The same goes for the pillows and bed linens. The decor was soothing. The rooftop garden was beautiful and we were able to relax on Monday afternoon because during the weekend, the garden was used for weddings. Perfect place for an intimate ceremony. Took a peek at one of the banquet rooms and it was nice, too. The only problem we had was the bathroom was a little dated, but it was clean and roomy. The water would not turn off completely in the tub, but you didn't hear it at all. I would recommend this hotel and hope to use it again when I visit my son.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: PatsyRodriguez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night because we were attending a wedding at the Vibiana. The location was fantastic because it was only one block away but that's where the good stops. It looks like they spent all their money renovating the lobby because the room was in horrible condition! The carpet was dirty, the room was small and cramped, the shower and bathroom had mildew, the furniture was old and torn. Even the tv was a small 19" that wa so snowy we couldn't see anything. I would never stay here again nor would I recommend anyone to say here.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mona77
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at this hotel, everything was perfect in my opinion. I have to say that I'm not used to accommodations of this category, I usually stay in simpler places, so this review comes from a small budget traveller who went there thanks to a special offer. I booked a double room for single use and it was really big, with lots of space to put my things and to relax. The bed was fantastic, I slept so well there! Both room and bathroom were clean and in perfect conditions. From the window the view on the skyscrapers of LA was very nice and I could also look down at the Japanese gardens. There was lots of space also in the common areas, even if I didn't spend much time to use all the facilities that this hotel offers. The staff is great, I got very good advices from them about the town and they also changed my room to the one with the decoration I liked the most. The position is very good, there's a metro stop not far from there and in something like 15 minutes by foot you can go to various interesting places of downtown LA such as the Disney Concert Hall, the Cathedral, Union Station, El Pueblo, City Hall, ecc... This hotel fits very well the style of Japanese district and near it there are lovely shops and restaurants to feel like in Tokyo. And the Gardens... particular and original for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Would not return...”
Reviews.Author: Nikki D
Reviews.Content: My husband is currently deployed with the US Army and he was able to return home to me for a single weekend so I booked a room at Kyoto because I thought it would be a great fit. I booked the daycation package and wrote the staff a comment when I reserved it through your online reservation site that I really need this to be a special stay..and pre-thank them for making sure all is ready to go. We arrived at the hotel around 3:30pm and when I began to check in they said they had booked us a room with 2 queen beds and had no record of the daycation package purchased. I showed them my confirmation email on my phone and they said they didnt have any record of it in their files and asked if I could email it to them. Upset since I had planned the package as a surprise my husband used my phone to email it to 3 different addresses the check-in agent asked him to. When we got to our room we set our things down and heard music blaring loudly from another area of the hotel, there was a wedding going on outside in the garden and we were not able to go through the Japanese gardens as a party was in process. I booked this hotel since his family owns an architectural landscaping firm and I thought he'd enjoy seeing it...we could not even take a look outside. We walked to dinner nearby and later returned to the hotel to order up the champagne included in the package and rent our movie also. When we tried to order the staff said they had no record of it in their computers still so we were charged separately until they said it showed up and they could process a refund. His flight the following morning was at 8:40 am from LAX so we woke up at 6am hoping to get ready and check out. When we were checking out I noticed that we were charged for a movie and when I brought this up to the girl at the check out desk she said shed review the order and make sure that she took it off. We left and I dropped him off at LAX for another 9 months away...when I checked my credit card statement it appears that I was charged twice for our stay-both in different amounts. I will be calling the hotel tomorrow to talk to them about this. Terrible stay, we did not even receive a portion of what I booked and I will not be seeing my husband again for a long time. I couldn't have been more disappointed and regret spending the few moments I have with him at your establishment.

Reviews.Title: “LA Marathon”
Reviews.Author: TwinMomAS33270
Reviews.Content: The TV was fuzzy, and we had to argue with the staff about the parking fee, because we could not even park in the structure because of the L.A. Marathon. We told them we were with the marathon, but they put us on the floor where all the St. Patrick's day party people were staying, so they were not conducive to a restful sleep. The location was perfect for meeting the shuttle to the marathon, the room was nice, though there was a leftover hairband from the previous guest on the door handle in the bathroom. The hotel was gorgeous, and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Even the phone was broken”
Reviews.Author: JenHillJHCCS
Reviews.Content: I didn't have high expectations for this hotel to begin with, but even with my lowered expectations they they still managed to disappoint. The phone was broken. The clock didn't even work. The rooms were old with broken and ripped furniture. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and surroundings”
Reviews.Author: kimuchi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times, from back when it was called the New Otani. We saw the rooms gradually get more and more dingy to the point where we no longer stayed here, but we came back when they started upgrading and remodeling. The location is wonderful, especially if you appreciate being right next door to Little Tokyo, with its Japanese markets, restaurants, and the Kinokuniya Bookstore. Many Japanese guests stay in the hotel, and the breakfast buffet has a couple of (so so) Japanese dishes. We are hoping that the Hilton chain will have sense enough not to destroy the unique Japanese flavor of this hotel. (Are they really going to call it the "Doubletree by Hilton" and let it go at that?) The hotel is also within easy walking distance (10-15 minutes) of the Disney Concert Hall, the LA City Hall, Olvera Street, the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels, Los Angeles Union Station, the discount stores of the Garment District and Toy Districts, and the Japanese American National Museum. Freeway access is also excellent. We were disappointed in the buffet breakfast in the Azalea Restaurant. If the food was any good, then the $18 price might be acceptable, but it is very mediocre quality and showed a general lack of care in preparation. The way-overcooked scrambled eggs and the tasteless, soggy (even when freshly put out!) potatoes were especially nasty. Unfortunately it was too expensive to put together an interesting breakfast from the a la carte menu. The only sensible choice for us was the American Breakfast (eggs, potatoes, meat, toast, juice and coffee/tea) at $12, which is actually quite good and which of course benefits from being cooked to order. I complained about the buffet breakfast when I stayed here last November and the manager wrote me back that they were planning to improve it, but I didn't see any change on our current trip. Those potatoes are REALLY AWFUL! We found the hotel and restaurant service to be friendly and helpful -- no problems there. This hotel kind of nibbles away at you with extra charges, like $24 a day for parking and $10 a day for Internet connection. For parking, you can find cheaper places nearby if you look around, and I heard that the Starbucks just next door to the Azalea Restaurant has free Internet. For one minor gripe, I found it bizarre that you can't get a newspaper anywhere in the hotel. If you're lucky you might find an LA Times left in the vending machine outside (bring lots of quarters), or if you don't mind waiting in the long coffee line, you can get the New York Times, the LA Times, and the Wall Street Journal next door at Starbucks. All in all my wife and I always find this hotel a very nice place to stay and we hope to come again soon.

Reviews.Title: “During construction”
Reviews.Author: Shari C
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel over all and the gardens are beautiful. However, do make sure you get a room that is post-remodel. I was initially given a room that had not been renovated yet and it was awful. Small, dingy and plain. Most significantly was the bathroom faucet ran and when I tried to turn faucet to adjust it, I found it only had two speeds, full blast - splashing the mirror or not completely off, to where it ran a steady stream. The front desk employees were incredibly nice though and upgraded me to a post construction room, without any hesitation or challenge. So, in the end, I did have a nice stay but I was disappointed in the first room. I'm sure it will be great, once they've finished their renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with friendly service in Japan town.”
Reviews.Author: Mendel17
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with excellent service. Truly helpful frontdesk staff and other staff. Very nice views from higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: suen l
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotel experiences Iâ€™ve ever had. My complaint is with the terrible service I received from the front desk staff and not hotel amenities, although the condition of the room is a bit dated. The bathroom faucet would not stop dripping and the room ceilings looked like something from 1960s. When I first checked into the hotel on Friday morning (3am) the person at the front desk did not appear to know what he were doing. He seemed like he was arguing with the other person at the front desk about which room to give me. As a result, I was standing there at 3am for 20 minutes waiting for him to check me in. I understand if you are â€œnew,â€� but at 3am, the last thing a customer wants to do is wait for 20 minutes while you try to figure out what to do. Not to mention that I could barely understand what he was saying. When I had asked him how much the internet charge was, he told me $9.99 per day. The next morning at 8:30am, I was woken up to a drill (due to hotel renovation) in what felt like the room next door. Unfortunately, the drilling and construction work seemed to go on for the entire day. This means that if you plan to visit this â€œbusiness hotelâ€� and try to work out of it, donâ€™t plan on it since youâ€™ll definitely be distracted by the sound. As a matter of fact, donâ€™t plan to sleep past 8am either if you are a light sleeper like I am. When I finally called down to the front desk to complain, the staff replied â€œ â€œOh didnâ€™t you see the signs at the front.â€� First, â€œI did not see any signsâ€� and more importantly â€œwhy would you put your hotel guests in a room where construction work was occurring next door?â€� She assured us that Friday was the last day that construction was going to occur. Saturday & Sunday morning at 9:22am, I started to hear the drills again. When I called down again, they said, oh we didnâ€™t know this was happening but you can talk to our supervisor if you like. My reply was â€œI donâ€™t want to waste anymore time with this but will speak to your supervisor when I check out.â€� When I checked out, I had complained again, and they said â€˜oh sorry, weâ€™ll have our supervisor give you a call to talk to you more about it.â€� I politely left my number with them and have not yet received a call. Also, the internet charge for the room is $9.99 per computer although the front desk only told us $9.99 per day. For the same price, Iâ€™d stay at a Kimpton property hotel or The Standard instead this hotel charges $25 per day for parking anyways. At least at those other hotels, I can expect better customer service and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “old, but swanky hotel - needs renovations”
Reviews.Author: gt234
Reviews.Content: hairs were all over the bathroom, on the towels, hand and bath. breakfast in the morning was prompt and ok, cottage cheese didn't taste too good. 7th floor wireless did not connect and then i still got a $9.95 charge on the bill. staff at front desk are mildly friendly, do not go above and beyond to help you. overall comfortable stay, close to where i needed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of certain issues until the Doubletree transition is completed”
Reviews.Author: Engineer911
Reviews.Content: I felt the need to review this hotel again despite having reviewed it a couple years ago. The first thing to note is that the prices have gone up a little bit, but that's acceptable because compared to the other hotels in downtown LA, this one is still a bargain. I believe in my last review that I said they don't charge more for the renovated "deluxe" rooms (which are on the higher floors). However this time there was a difference of maybe +/- $20/night between the standard and deluxe rooms on their website. The next item is that the Kyoto is in the process of becoming a Doubletree by Hilton. I believe they said this should be completed sometime in the summer of 2012. For me this is long overdue, as I use this hotel frequently when downtown for business, and getting Diamond recognition and credit (points) for my stays is always a positive. But the drawback is that lots of things are being worked on and there were major maintenance issues during my stay last week (early Feb 2012). The deluxe room has a great large HD LCD tv in it, but this does you no good when there's only about 10 channels that come in at all. And at that, only half of those were of watchable because the picture quality was so horrific. There was no HD on any channel. Every channel that I enjoy watching when unwinding in the evenings was totally out (A&E and Travel Channel). On the first night I asked maintenance to come up and see if they could fix the television. The tech came up and said that the satellite people have known about it for a while and that they don't know when it is going to be resolved. I got a key to another room on a different floor just to verify the outage was affecting more than just my room. I suspect they aren't going to fix it, and am hoping they are just going to put a whole new TV system in place. Not being able to enjoy television (for me) is a HUGE problem. When I called the front desk to express my dissatisfaction, they said they could comp a day of my parking, which they did, but that didn't do anything for me whatsoever since it was a business trip and it was me, not the company, that was having to deal with the problem. It would have been so much better if they would have offered me a room credit that I could have applied toward all the times I ate/drank in the lounge. The next thing is the water. In my last review I stated that the bathrooms in even the deluxe rooms are very old. Old to where when you turn the light on in the bathroom you can hear the lights "clink" on, and the sink/vanity is VERY low. But on this trip they must have been doing work with the plumbing and water pressure, because on one occasion when I turned on the water, nothing came out, I heard a loud bumping noise and then it shot water out like an explosion and ended up all over me and my pants. Not the best situation when you're about to walk downstairs for dinner. On another occasion during my stay, I turned on the water and again heard the grumbling sound in the pipes and it shot out brown/dirty water. And on the morning I checked out, a note was under the door that they were doing maintenance and that the water supply for the entire hotel would be turned off for short period of time. Here's the thing about this hotel - the price is good and the people are terrific. They have a great staff and everyone from the bar to the room service to the valet are all wonderful. Being right downtown next to the Japanese village with great restaurants and shops is a huge bonus, and if you want to go a little further, the hotel has a free shuttle (remember to tip, people!). So I'd gladly give them another chance, but I truly hope that this Doubletree upgrade will involve a re-do of the bathrooms and vanities, fix the plumbing issues, and get a real TV channel line up with HD channels. Having those things would finally make this a truly fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jury Duty Stay”
Reviews.Author: califtraveler12
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very comfortable rooms. Food is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - nice hotel - easy to find”
Reviews.Author: Joey4815
Reviews.Content: Through the madness of LA traffic this hotel in the south was extremly easy to find. The hotel was very clean and the hotel is beautiful. Standard rooms are very comfy and the beds are fantastic. We really enjoyed are time here. You are less than 1 minute away from the freeways north and south connections. Dont worry you cant hear the traffic if people are thinking this. You are also less than 2 minutes from the Disney concert halls. Didnt get the chance to catch a show but would have been nice. All the hotel location made it easy to get to all locations around LA - 10minutes from Hollywood 15 mins from BH and so on. For my first time in LA I was glad to have spent my time here. If I ever need to go back I would believe this would be the hotel I would book with time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Learning Experiment!”
Reviews.Author: BloominDiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a quick trip to LA for the LA Autoshow. I let him choose the hotel (here's where the learning starts!), and decided I would wear my "easy going" cap for this quickie trip. This hotel was a great deal on line and I loved the idea of a Japanese approach to our accommodations. After braving the rush hour traffic in LA to get to the hotel, we were in a hurry to check in and get to your dinner engagement. I had read on line that some of the rooms had been recently renovated, so checked with the person checking us in to make sure we were in one of the updated rooms. She replied that it was "semi-renovated" (learning continues...). Upon reaching our room, which was spatially adequate,it felt a little old and dingy. The bedding ensemble was new and styled very nicely ~ I think was the "semi-renovated" element our check-in attendant was referring to. There was also some new, very cool wall paper on the wall behind the bed. Everything else was very standard and in need of updating. Upon returning from our night out in Downtown LA around Staples center, we were famished and had walked around for a while trying to find something open to grab a late night bite at. With very little available, we took a cab back to our hotel and thought we'd order room service. Alas, no room service available. While there is a lounge in the hotel lobby, there is no food service. There is also a restaurant, but it closes early in the evening. I thought all of this was very strange, however it was a Thursday night. The front desk provided us with a Dominos Pizza menu and also found a menu for a Thai restaurant that delivers. The single desk attendant suggested we walk just a couple blocks down the street where we would find many restaurants open. We walked quite a long ways and there really was nothing open. This is not the best part of town I might add, and we felt it best to get back to our room. We ended up calling the Thai restaurant and ordering ~ eating at 1:30 am and it was pretty good. But really, in the future, I will not stay at a hotel without room service or adequate dining options close by. The bathroom, while functional and relatively clean had a loose faucet and just really needed to be updated. The bed however, was very comfortable and the bedding was nice ~ again, part of that semi-remodeled effort. If you're going to LA and will be out and about, not spending time in your room, it is definitely an adequate stay. I do think that you'll do better just a few blocks towards the center of downtown with other options such as the historic Millenium Biltmore which is actually great value. I won't choose to stay here again and definitely will do more research before I let my beloved do the choosing again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: DesertDweller32
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Kyoto Grand. Thanks to the Trip Advisor community, we checked in with a list of our preferences: updated room, highest possible floor, city view. The Kyoto Grand was able to meet these requests cheerfully, and our room looked exactly like the photos on the website. The room was stocked with quality bathroom products (soaps, shampoos, conditioners, lotions). Housekeeping efficiently brought up toothpaste when requested (we ran out!). Found out (too late!) that there was a fridge in the room (check out the area under the TV!) Used the treadmill in the fitness room both nights of our stay. Basic machine, but entirely functional and well-maintained. We didn't utilitze hotel parking; parked at Joe's directly across the street for significant savings. Used the guest shuttle once; the driver couldn't have been nicer and more gracious ~ excellent! Loved the expansive dining options in Little Tokyo ~ literally a block or so away. Sushi choices abound! Really, truly loved our stay at the Kyoto Grand ~ a solid choice when travelling to downtown Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Would've gone elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: DentistDorisUSN
Reviews.Content: I should have parked across the street for a flat rate of $5 (weekend price after 4pm), but it was too dark to see the price sign. Hotel self parking was $24/night. Valet was $30. I get to my room and I notice two white dried liquid stains on the red pillow.... So gross! The next morning I am out of the shower and about to apply lotion except for the bottle is empty and the maids never bothered to change the bottle after someone used it! Great view from 20th floor. Light in front of the bathroom could use an upgrade instead of a cheap, yellow fluorescent light.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay for Three Nights”
Reviews.Author: Ryan S
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel. Room is very clean and spacious, bathroom is a little small though. A big flat screen TV, few channel options. Bed is too soft for someone like me. During my stay, the room rates included a $70 dollars package (parking, wifi and breakfast), very great value. Breakfast variety was great. Hotel location is near Japantown (great dining options), but it is still 10-15 minutes walking to downtown and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Really good!”
Reviews.Author: Thiago2601
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at this hotel in November/2011 and just had a very nice experience there! The room is spacious, nice bathroom with a good bath and really good amenities. The bed is just amazing. The staff is really helpful and is ready to help you with anything you need, at any time. The hotel also has a lot of shops and restaurants (including the StarBucks in the lobby). Great location in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Some Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: Contributor42
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable for access to Japan town. There is a walkway to the shopping center with Kinokuniya which is supposed to close at 7, and the front entrance is not much farther. We did have three issues which marred the experience. First, they charge $24 a day for parking, but their website where we made the reservation stated $10 a night, and we didn't find out until it was too late. When we stayed at the Miyako Hotel nearby we only paid $10 a night. Second, we requested a crib for our room, but it wasn't delivered to the room. The hotel operator never answered, so we had to go downstairs twice to get it sorted out. Finally, the side access door to the Kinokuniya center was supposed to close at 7, but it was closed an hour early, forcing us to walk around to the front entrance to get in. This was particularly troublesome because we had a stroller, and since the elevator was broken it was necessary to carry it up 4 flights of stairs to find out the door was closed early, and then back down.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for what we paid, a couple downfalls though.”
Reviews.Author: Colombianvacationer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice beds and rooms. We paid a great price but they make it up in other ways. $24 a day for parking seemed high for someone staying in your hotel but the convenience factor out weighed the issue. Either Bookit.com made a mistake or the hotel but they would not honor a $50 dining credit voucher that was given for staying 3 nights or more. Bookit.com did refund the $50 though. Also the hotel charged my credit card for the total amount of staying three days that was already paid for so the trouble of staying on the phone close to 30 minutes each call I made to get the problems resolved put a damper on the stay. Very frustrating. The hotel is very close to I guess what would be homeless central. Not the best part of town to be in at night. Overall a great hotel but the issues with my credit card being charged twice and the dining voucher not being honored was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto Hotel & Gardens”
Reviews.Author: TTMedel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights while our son underwent surgery at USC Keck Medical Center. The staff was very professional and friendly. The hotel offers complimentary shuttle service to and from the hospital. This was a huge selling point for us. The drivers were extremely kind and courteous. We can't say enough good things about the drivers. They also double as bellmen and they're very good at both. The food in the lounge was very tasty. Unfortunately we did not get to experience the gardens or other restaurants on site. We did have an incident one night with a couple fighting next door that wasn't resolved as quickly as we would have liked, but security did respond both times I called. We would not hesitate to stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Bismarck D
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room was well styled and the bed was extremely comfortable. I actually wanted to spend time in my room. Best of all was the service. Everyone I met was courteous and helpful. I felt welcomed and appreciated. The gardens were beautiful, hard to beleive we were in downtown. Look forward to staying again

Reviews.Title: “Some beauty and grace in the heart of downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: hscheff
Reviews.Content: I went to do a site visit for bringing in a conference of about 500 people. There were plenty of breakout rooms and a ballroom that divides into 1/3 and 2/3. The Foyer infron ot the ballrrom is very spacious and can hold many vendors. We found the lobby staff to be atatentive and fun while being efficient. There is a fitness center which will be expanding over the next few months Little Japan is a short walk away with all manner of shops and eateries. Hotel food was good and reasonably priced. The decor is certainly Japanese influences with a wonderfully unique Japanese chandalier hanging over the lobby. I am sure our registrants will enjoy being in this space.

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Compare”
Reviews.Author: BVostmyer
Reviews.Content: Just let me say - this is an amazing hotel. From the comfortable rooms to the rooftop garden to the eggs benedict, I was impressed by this hotel...and I am a hard person to impress. The one standout is the service! I stayed here while my husband was having surgery and went in to the hotel since it was close to the hospital and they provided transport back and forth. What I did not expect was such gracious and understanding service. The check-in was done quickly and considered my requests. The bellmen were very sensitive to my needs to get back and forth to the hospital as quickly as possible. But when my husband was discharged and we stayed one extra night in the hotel, the service kicked in to overdrive. The bellman and hotel manager assisted my husband in getting to our room as the hotel wheelchair was checked out to another guest. The bellman helped me get to the drug store for supplies and prescriptions. Room requests were answered immediately. Overall, they went above and beyond what I would have expected and was very impressed. One very small con was room service in the evening and it may have just been my choices off the menu. The "flatbread pizza" is made using a thick pizza dough and the chicken teriyaki one is pretty bad. Sandwiches and salads were just fine and the food in the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Richard A's Review”
Reviews.Author: Richard A
Reviews.Content: Booked a reservation same night on on a Thursday, 12/1/11 because of the recent wind storms in SoCal knocked out my power and I needed internet access and a place to stay due to a presentation I was preparing due that Saturday. Great customer service from the time I booked the reservation to throughout my stay to the day of check out on 12/3/11 . I was a returning guest so I was offered the "welcome back" rate and stayed in a deluxe room while saving a few $$$. I loved the newly remodeled room with the flat screen tv and also had a great view on the 19th floor. The internet service / wifi on hand was very fast and I completed the project I was working on Friday night. I had time to enjoy the sites and restaurants in Little Tokyo and I am seriously considering checking in again on a weekend later in December or January for a get away with my girlfriend! Only 2 minor issues to mention. My room keys did not work initially, but no big deal. Also, I could faintly hear the sirens and helicopters outside even if I was on the 19th floor. A light sleeper may have issues with that. But, with all the emergencies from the wind storms, it was understandable. Glad I checked in to Kyoto Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value and service”
Reviews.Author: AngelaBax
Reviews.Content: Comfortable modern clean rooms - would definitely stay here again. Close to great Japanese restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Sjursaether
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, and even though the hotel itself is okay, its starting to get a little old and I was not happy with all the extra fees. Im not from US, so Im used to having free WiFi and parking. But here I had to pay 24 dollar to park in the garage for 9 hours, really? 9 something dollar per device in the room per 24 hour... Not impressed. The bed was really good, and I had a great view, big windows in room which made it pretty open. Tv was old and not working right. Shower was not perfectly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy it very much”
Reviews.Author: wj9893
Reviews.Content: Only thing i did not like was the 30.00 vallet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Buisness and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Christopher H
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a very attentive and friendly staff. The room was a little small but had all of the amenities. A small refrigerator in the room was a very welcome addition. The location is perfect for visits to most of the shopping districts and Little Tokyo. The Hotel Restaurant was not a good experience for us as the service was slow. But it is attached to a shopping center with quite a few nice restaurants off of the Japanese Garden (That was excellent). The Bed was very nice, which is saying allot from me. The bathroom could have been a little larger as well. Because of the room size I gave an average rating. Overall though it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great price from Hotwire and excellent downtown location”
Reviews.Author: aspen5
Reviews.Content: If you go to Hotwire, downtown LA, and see 3.5 stars - it's likely the Kyoto. At $105-$110 per night this is a great value. The rooms are very comfortable; restaurant is very good - burgers are excellent; kobe meatloaf good also. A little noisy lately with the Occupy LA movement at city hall - you can't hear them but there appears to be a lot of helicopters flying around.

Reviews.Title: “Money better spent elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: kymberw
Reviews.Content: The fantastically comfortable beds and friendly service were the highlight of my time at this hotel. The problems were small, but added together became frustrating during my 5 night stay. The gym was poorly appointed, the internet was so slow and inconsistent that I couldn't get the work done that I needed to do. We had five people in our party (checked in separately). Some of us were not provided the breakfast and drink coupons that came withour rooms, and ended up paying for our own then having it taken off our bills later.

Reviews.Title: “Jury duty”
Reviews.Author: Laurensbca
Reviews.Content: I was at the Kyoto Grand the weekend prior for leisure and our room on the 16th floor was great. There were no problems, clean, comfortable, large and a fantastic sunset view of downtown. A week later I was called to federal jury duty and being over 80 miles distant, I stayed at the Kyoto again. This time time the 14th floor, view more to the back, the mountains. Sill very nice. I'd have to get very picky to say that the water pressure was somewhat on the low side, and the second room had a bad aerator on the sink, causing water to flow sideways. The price was great. They offer government rates and were very flexible about accommodating my uncertainties with the jury schedule. The continental buffet was fine for a quick breakfast, and parking rates are average for the area, valet or self-park. There is a Starbucks on the same block if you like your coffee close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Suprise! Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Angiet2
Reviews.Content: We needed to be in downtown LA for a seminar and were stunned at the prices of hotels! Finally, we found a $99 per night deal at the Kyoto. We (of course!) read the reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to go for it. So GLAD WE DID!! We needed two beds and after a quick and friendly call to Marianne at the front office, she took care of the change for us. We called the hotel with a couple of other questions before our trip, and we were always treated kindly and given thorough answers to our questions. The bell staff were very friendly at check in, Self Parking ($24 per night) was a breeze. The front desk team was very friendly and made us feel very welcomed. We had a room on the 20th floor and it had a nice view of downtown. We were actually able to open the windows and WOW!, even though this is just a small thing, we so loved getting fresh air in the room. We were actually able to leave the a/c turned off and just enjoyed the cool, autumn breezes. The beds/linens are FANTASTIC!!! I have stayed at the Ritz/4 Seasons/JW Marriotts/etc, and these beds/linens were equally as wonderful as any of those high end, pricey hotels. Another nice touch in the room is having a small fridge. No mini-bar items to deal with... just an empty fridge in the room, waiting for us and our beverages! The only room for improvment would be better toiletries... They were some low-end hotel brand, when it would be nice to have L'Occitane/Bath & Body Works/Crabtree...etc... Not a big deal, at all...just the only thing I could think of where this stay could have been improved re: the room and amenities. The one other major place that MUST be improved: The business center is basically non-existent. There is only ONE working computer and the printer is hit and miss, at best. Since there is only 1 working PC, there was always someone camped out on it, with other guests, waiting. If you don't need a printer and have your laptop with you, you can go to Starbucks in the hotel and access their wi-fi. We enjoyed a nice dinner at Azalea Restaurant, one night. The service was friendly, the food was a strong B+. I think that $15 for fish and chips with only two little pieces of fish, is not the best deal in town. That's just the name of the game, when dining at a hotel, I guess. The dinner salad was really good and I would give that a strong A+ rating (especially the bleu cheese, home-made dressing!). Great Hotel! Winning staff! Great beds! Truly, a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: perryfamilyAZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in October. I had a room on the 20th floor that had recently been renovated. This hotel has nice large rooms. The lobby is in need of some renovation, but I heard from the staff that this hotel was recently purchased by a new ownership group and will be renamed as a Doubletree in 2012. The hotel staff was awesome, the front desk staff and bell staff were great. The hotel has a free shuttle that will take you around downtown LA, I took the shuttle to LA Live. The only downside is the location. The hotel is in the "Civic" area of downtown near city hall, LAPD and court buildings. After 5 PM it is a ghost town.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistant Service”
Reviews.Author: conrights2003
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an oasis in the area where it is located. After driving toward "Little Tokyo and seeing some seedy looking hotels and blighted, vacant areas , it is truly aesthetically pleasing Hotel. The decor and rooms where quite comfortable and the Japanese Garden was a peaceful pleasure. The Desk staff, when we arrived were quite welcoming, but at other times, they seemed more interested in conversing amongst themselves, than waiting on patrons. We only ate breakfast at the hotel. The greeter was slow to come to seat me and at least on one occasion, I had to seat myself, get my own coffee cup and pour my own coffee. While the room was clean, it appeared that the cleaning staff took more care in cleaning the room the day before we left than during the rest of our stay ( my wife and I were there for 3 nights and 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: LeavingVegasBehind
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times while visiting USC hospital. The staff is great. Rooms are clean and quiet. The hotel restaurant is good and there is a Starbuck's attached to the hotel. Front desk staff always has suggestions for restaurants. Hotel is located in little Tokyo so there is an abundance of sushi and asian restaurants surrounding the hotel. There is also a pizza place two blocks away. They have a free shuttle service to downtown areas and probably other areas of town - just check with the front desk or operator. We take it to USC hospital. They are very accommodating and drivers have always been very friendly. (Shuttle does not go to the airport.) Most visitors appear to be on business and there's a few like us that are going back and forth to the hospital. This hotel will become a Doubletree property in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “A few snafus”
Reviews.Author: RedbudChicago
Reviews.Content: While the Kyoto Grand was clean and the rooms were nice, some of the services were missing a beat. The business center was not open early in the morning, included people camped out there with papers all over the carrels for hours in the evening, and the printer did not work (an empty ink cartridge with no one available to check it out), and no other alternative for printing a boarding pass. The garage and motor lobby was consistently crowded with services trucks. A town car reserved for 5 am by the front desk never showed up, which is never a good experience for a traveler. It needs to up its game for me to come back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - difficult to find and no wifi”
Reviews.Author: gundesmontir
Reviews.Content: We were travelling from Las Vegas to LA late and it was really difficult to find the hotel, also with their front desk's indications. Finally, after one hour and a nice policeman's correct indications we found it. The room is fine, and the hotel is classy and a bit old-fashioned but really comfy and cozy. The gardens are beautiful also. What we mostly missed was a wifi for customers, they only have 4 computers to share.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KAmandaR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights during a business trip and enjoyed it. The staff was very friendly and super helpful. The room was spotless and the view was amazing. I ate two meals at Azalea, the hotel restaurant, and found them both tasty and reasonably priced. The cab from LAX to the hotel was insane, but that's to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Businesses and Meetings Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elvin16
Reviews.Content: Bathroom need some updates. The fusel had need to be replaced because of the hard water residues.

Reviews.Title: “A short, pleasant stay at the Kyoto Grand.”
Reviews.Author: Mars21
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference to attend in LA and we stayed for four nights at this hotel. They were refinishing the concrete areas in front of the building, but it didn't inconvenience us too much...just some dust and noise. The lobby and common areas were neat and clean. The room was a good size and the bathroom was functional, if not a bit dated. The bed was extremely comfortable. The only real problem was that the walls are thin enough to hear other people's music and conversation. Some woman was yakking in the hall at 3 AM and it sounded like she was talking directly into my ear! One thing I would have appreciated was a daily paper. Our wifi was included in our package, not sure whether it would be worth it to pay $9.95 each day (which needs to be renewed every 24 hours). The staff were all excellent. They were always professional and friendly, particularly the shuttle drivers. We made use of the complimentary shuttle on a few occasions and it was much appreciated. It is about a 10 minute walk from Union Station, so if you don't have a lot of luggage, you can save the cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: DRoman00
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and smelled good. Beds were comfy. Had a slight issue with door, which engineering came out and fixed right away. Front desk was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was right across from wedding location (Vibiana). Room service was quick and delicious. I'll be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto Grand is the antithesis of "grand"”
Reviews.Author: Katherine L
Reviews.Content: Anyone who knows me will tell you that I am very nice and easygoing. With that in mind, i will tell you this: I have never had as bad an hotel experience as I did here at Kyoto Grand Hotel and Gardens. Here for my best friend's wedding, the hotel was chosen due to its location and famed garden. Strike 1: I was told upon check- in that there were no more rooms available on the 21st floor despite the fact that much communication was made on the importance of saving rooms on this floor for our bridal party members and the fact that I'd booked the room 1.5 months prior Strike 2: after specifically requesting a room with 2 double beds, we were reassigned to another floor with a room with only 1 king bed. Strike 3: After going to the front desk, yet again, to tell them about the issue... somehow a room with 2 beds "magically" became available on the 21st floor, when it was already 11 pm and only 5 minutes prior, I was told the floor was completely booked. Strike 4: the newly assigned room had the most God-awful stench I have ever smelled in my life, even with the fan on. The smell was confirmed to be completely unbearable by several of my friends who came by to visit. It was too late into the evening to switch rooms again and due to our wedding party commitments, I couldn't request a room change until the next night. When I did, the front desk associate had a bad attitude. I told him about the situation and the disgusting, nauseating, permeating smell in the room. He was short with me and said "it looks like you've already switched rooms." I was so angry by this point and wanted to scream at him and management: if they didn't keep messing up my reservation and put me in such a situation, I would NOT even need to be wasting my time in complaining to them and switching rooms over and over again. I was finally switched to yet another room. In short, I will tell you this: I have NEVER had such a bad hotel experience, not even at a low-end Motel 6 with cockroaches scurrying around (true story). I would NEVER stay at the Kyoto Grand Hotel and Gardens again, nor would I recommend it to anyone, not even my worst enemy. You could not pay me to stay at this establishment again; it was beyond horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: The room was good, the houskeeping was good. The food was very good. The fitness room was inadequate, one outdated treadmill and two outdated stationary bicycles. The hotel did not carry a single newspaper which I always want in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, City Views, Cool location”
Reviews.Author: Roon B
Reviews.Content: We were on the 19th floor and loved the views of L.A. from this vantage point. The hotel itself is very nice. Our room was average as far as amenities go, but the bed was super lush and the t.v. was big, even if the remote was one of the more frustrating we've ever encountered! The location is an interesting one that is a great jumping off point for some cool places in L.A.'s Chinatown, Little Tokyo and more. The only bummer was the parking garage which is tight and could be inconvenient if you have a larger car (Navigator, etc...). The staff was great and the service at the bars and restaurants was too. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: karina k
Reviews.Content: Just checked into this hotel and its a nightmare. They have really loud construction going on daily until 9:30 pm drilling and all! The rooms that they have on the web are their deluxe renovated rooms- which are not available to guests booking through hotels.com or any other 3rd party sites. The hotel is old and needs major renovations. Rooms are 2 1/2 stars tops.

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto is not grand.”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: No wheelchair access. Parking is a joke (and is $25/day). No hot water in our room. We called room service to ask for a cup of hot water to warm a baby bottle (because of no hot water in room), and instead of an "I'm sorry. How can we remedy that problem?" we received a "we'll have to charge you for a cup of hot water." Various, repetitive loud noises in our room throughout the night. Both the room and the hotel just had the same dingy, abandoned feeling that permeates Little Tokyo. I was there for a wedding and thank God I have no reason to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay at the Kyoto Grand. The room was quiet, the views were fabulous and the amenities great. Very clean, no smelly smells, nice TV and comfortable bed. The water pressure in the shower was a bit weak and the tub a little small but I still give it 5 stars for a quiet room at night for a good night's sleep. I would definitely come back here to stay. The location was great, walking distance to the Geffen, MOCA and JANM as well as plenty of places to eat nearby. Free wifi at Starbucks downstairs. Lots of cops around since it is just a half block from LAPD HQ. Parking next door under Weller Place is cheaper than the hotel valet. We paid $26. for two nights in the garage next door. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and accommodating. When the in house wifi (paid) didn't work very well, they refunded my money. I like the quietness....not near major freeways...we were on the 17th floor. It looks like they are remodeling some areas so construction during the day. We will be back next time we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “lack of organization special attention”
Reviews.Author: janjam813
Reviews.Content: Fhey garden venue for the wedding should have been better prepared. too many services back to back. during our ceremony we could here chatter and clatter coming from the kitchen during the most sacred parts, Very tacky anf rude. The garden looked messy as well

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy”
Reviews.Author: Joe H
Reviews.Content: Nice room -- slept well which isn't typical for me when away. Meeting room was a great venue for the meeting I attended...some construction related noise interfered. Only real complain was for the late dinner I had. I arrived slightly after 8:00pm knowing what I wanted but it took almost an hour to deliver and take my payment for a simple flatbread. The server was working hard to stay on top of everyone, but it appeared that she was the only person working the front area. My meal was fine. Breakfast was great. Again a very attentive wait staff combined with a tasty breakfast started the day off well. If given the opportunity will definitely choose this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: kokoa
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay-we chose this hotel because it is right in Little Tokyo and that was the purpose of our weekend stay. The hotel was nice; lobby attractive in Asian decor - black and red; the rooms were nicely decorated and clean - we were on the 21st floor and our room had a nice view and had no problems whatsoever. Hotel staff. We ate outside the hotel during our entire stay so I cannot comment on the hotel's restaurant nor the other amenities, such as the gym, etc.; however, right next to the hotel is a small mall with eateries and stores. There is also a Marukai (Japanese market) just around the corner of the hotel that was great. Forgot to mention that we booked a weekend rate of less than $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, small rooms, terrible parking”
Reviews.Author: Mijac821
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after a wedding. Beautiful spot for a small wedding, decent food. Found the room with two double beds quite small/crowded. The bathroom was even smaller. The phones and alarm clock are from the 80s. But the Japanese-ish decor is charming. Panting is tiny, underground garage where the valets have to park on the downhill lane. Then, though we stamped our parking for validation at the wedding the front desk staff tell us that it does include those who stayed overnight with them and that they will charge us $24! The mother of the bride was behind us and was outraged. The staff was rude and unreasonable. Eventually, the woman helping us begrudgingly "gave us" half price. Is that how they treat wedding parties who pay thousands of dollars? Next time we will stay elsewhere and they can keep their lousy room and parking

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for a room that had 3 pieces of tape to hold the batteries in the remote control”
Reviews.Author: Spacejammer
Reviews.Content: Ac unit did not have heat? I was freezing in the middle of the night and it got colder when I turned up the heat! I will not be going back I did not have a good experience because I was not a business person , I spent alot of money and my room was horrible! I will be writing a letter to your corprate office! Thanks for the terrible time!

Reviews.Title: “large rooms, big hotel, great gardens, good location”
Reviews.Author: kgermain
Reviews.Content: i stayed here as part of an organised tour (Contiki) and the rooms were lovely. they were clean and really comfortable. the rooms were large and we had a great view of the downtown LA area. the hotel is within walking distance of shops and the downtown area, and also the train - which we used to go to the Hollywood Area (about 10 min). the staff were very friendly and helpful. the lobby was spacious, heaps of room for meeting and hanging out. there is also a really good selection of (mostly) asian restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to Union Station”
Reviews.Author: mbuckland007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Union Station but there is not much else around, you need a car or use the Metro to get to other attraction and restaurants. Hotel is clean with great staff. Meals are good and breakfast included in the price. There was no jug provided to boil water for tea but there was a coffee perculator. King bed was very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for catching up on sleep after a long flight!”
Reviews.Author: travellintitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after a Contiki tour. The staff at reception were incredibly helpful and made us feel very welcome. The room was incredibly spacious offering two very comfortable queen size beds. It was also very handy to have a large fridge in the room. The hotel was quiet, offered internet access (first 5 mins free), and also boasted a beautiful rooftop garden. We enjoyed cocktails up there and sampled some of the barbequed food-all of which was delicious! Starbucks was located next to the hotel offering free wi-fi and Little Tokyo was a short walk away. The conceirge was helpful on both arrival and departure and arranged reasonably priced transport for us to the airport. It would have been nice to have had a pool in the hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Didn't want to leave :)”
Reviews.Author: Milena S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from August 29 to Sept 4th with my mom. We both had been trying to pick a hotel for weeks and read tons of reviews for several hotels. I finally made a decision and settled on the Kyoto Grand and it exceeded both of our expectations. Our original reservation through Expedia said we were getting one king bed, but when we checked in, the staff immediately offered us a room with two separate beds. Check-in was really fast. Our room was very clean and our beds were made up and our towels were changed daily. The beds are AMAZINGLY COMFORTABLE! Even after long days of walking around and sightseeing, we always felt refreshed the next day. Our window in the room was facing the beautiful garden. The bathroom was a little bit dated compared to the rest of the room, but it didn't bother us as it was always clean and everything worked. The shower had good water pressure. All of the staff at the Kyoto was friendly and helpful. They answered all of our questions and recommended places to go to in the area. One lady from the front desk, (I believe her name was Marisela) was extremely helpful. She booked a sightseeing tour for us around 10pm for the next morning. I realized the gift shop had closed and I needed to buy batteries for my camera, so I asked her if she knew where I could buy some - she told me to wait a sec and called someone from the hotel to bring me batteries, free of charge! We were a little reluctant to walk downtown by ourselves because we heard it was not safe at night, but it was perfectly fine, even for just two women. Shops and restaurants in Little Tokyo are open late, so we always felt safe and there was always something to do in the area. Pitfire Pizza is also a block away from the hotel in the opposite direction of Little Tokyo, so we went there for dinner a few times. Union Station is in walking distance to the hotel, as are several bus stops for various routes if you plan on taking the Metro. The Walt Disney Concert Hall and the Fashion District are also close by. The only things I could complain about was the hotel restaurant and the wi-fi. We had breakfast once at the restaurant and the servers offered us coffee before we got to see the menu, so unfortunately we didn't know that it was $4 each for coffee because of refills. Had we known that, we would have just got free coffee in the lobby. Wi-fi is expensive, about $10 a day. If you want it for less, you can go to Starbucks to use their internet. Other than that, I have only good things to say about the Kyoto Grand Hotel. Neither of us drive, but it was really easy for us to get around L.A. from the hotel by walking or taking the Metro. Coming back to the hotel was always a pleasure. The decor is beautiful, the atmosphere is really laid back, and the rooms are big and comfortable. It started to feel like home by the time we had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: kcirtapp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kyoto Grand Hotel for a night booked through Hotwire. The hotel is quite nice, with a beautiful Japanese Garden. It is walking distance to Little Tokyo. Parking is expensive but can be had much cheaper across the street. Beds are comfortable, bathrooms are a little outdated but nice. Overall a nice place and I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: rainydaytoast
Reviews.Content: Had 4 nights in this hotel via contiki tour. Rooms were a good size with two double beds which were very comfortable, also plush pillows! Shower pressure was great, there was no air vents in the bathroom though. Free wifi at Starbucks down stairs. No pool or spa which was unfortunate with the hot weather!

Reviews.Title: “A TASTE OF TOKYO”
Reviews.Author: ved_11
Reviews.Content: excellent location,close to the major tourist spots,shopping and offers 4 star rooms....very good food .....in fact the food leaves you craving for more! It is located downtown in fact in little tokyo....and has its own charm.take rooms in the higher floors and away from elevators.huge comfy beds for 4.flat tv ,starbucks coffee and all. very good staff and the hotel has this kind of a smell which is very inviting. i would like to go back....it was a good stay with its tokyo charm.

Reviews.Title: “One night wasn't enough for me”
Reviews.Author: RedCorvetteEnvy
Reviews.Content: I stayed on business and got in late after 9 p.m. That was a mistake because I wanted to explore the hotel more and the surrounding neighborhood in downtown. I booked on a travel site and got a $149 rate per night, which was a smoking deal for a hotel of this caliber. You get a mix of foreigners visiting L.A. and Americans who either are visiting SoCal or are on business, like me. I am definitely going back to Kyoto. Btw, we wandered next door to three-story outdoor mall and found a gem of a club called the Blue Whale Bar. There was a $10 cover, but it was worth it. There is jazz nightly and the bartenders are super attentive. You won't stand at the bar waiting to get noticed by the barkeep here. They serve food late, too.

Reviews.Title: “I don't have good impression for this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DoDoLeong
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel bcos my kids love Japanese food. The location is in Little Tokyo, within walking distance from many Japanese restaurants. The double beds room are small,old and dark. Carpet definitely need to change! It seems to me that the ventilation fan in the toilet wasn't working. No fridge. Carpark and Internet charges are very expensive. If possible, park behind or elsewhere. Will not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yaeliam
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We stayed one night before moving to our new apartment in LA. The service is great, the rooms are very spacious, clean and comfortable and it was cool being near Little Tokyo and so many great Japanese restaurants. We also got a great deal on the room through Hotwire. My only complaint is that they do not have airport shuttle from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: JimBrown
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled for surgery at the USC Medical Center (about 3 miles) and needed a room for my wife while I was in the hospital and for both of us for several days before and after my hospital stay. The hotel worked quite well for us for several reasons. First, the hotel has a free shuttle service for destinations relatively nearby, including downtown and to the Medical Center. Second, the hotel is located in the middle of "Little Tokyo," a cluster of Jethnic apanese businesses, including restaurants. Third, the hotel is far enough from what can be an intensely busy neighborhood, the area around the Staple Center, Nokia Center, and Convention Center. Fourth, the hotel is reasonable walking distance to other downtown restaurants and attractions (like the new Disney Concert Hall, Dorothy Chandler Pavilion, the restored Union Station, and some museums. We found the staff quite friendly and supportive during our stay. The only downside of staying here is that it's possible to get nickel and dimed to death with charges for parking and the internet. Make sure that you have something in writing about these charges before checking in. As to restaurants -- most of the Janpanese restaurants are pretty stodgy and not great. The best one we found was Chin Ma Ya, which is in a three level food court in the building next door to the hotel. Very tasty dishes, much more interesting than the others. There's a noodle shop (cash only, so no receipt to tell you the name) on the south side of 2nd street just west of the hotel that isn't bad. One of the nicest restaurants in the area is Traxx, which is in the concourse of Union Station. We had a great meal there one night, great food, very nice service, reasonable cost. As to breakfast -- there's a Starbucks at ground level adjacent to the back door of the hotel. The hotel advertises their Japanese garden, which is a very nice garden on the roof over the lobby of the hotel. It's open to all guests, and a very nice place to hang out. The downside is that the garden is often used for weddings and other events (mostly weekends), and those uses preempt use by other guests. Another downside is that there's no place to sit down in the garden unless it's set up for an event. As a tip to the hotel -- it would be very nice if there were always some tables and chairs scattered around the garden during non-event times.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in downtown LA that makes USC patients happy.....”
Reviews.Author: GlobalCanadian
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews of hotels that are close to USC, this one sounded the best, tho we did note that a few guests were not totally happy. We found it to be everything we needed for a stay for surgery. I am especially surprised by the negative comments made about the neighbourhood - Little Tokyo is minutes away and very cool, with a big market where i could buy food, water and a little kettle for our hotel room, and fabulous Japanese food to take away. A short twenty minute walk away was the "being gentrified as we speak" downtown area. Yes, some of this is seedy, and there are still alot of low budget shops and people hanging about, but this is downtown LA, people! And anyway, low budget does not necessarily imply garbage, and i thought the Latino atmosphere in some was festive, if cheap, and tho I passed several homeless people, not one of them EVER approached me or behaved in any way badly, and I was alone as my husband was recovering in the hotel room......do these people who complain insulate themselves from the real world of poverty all the time? Must be nice! Anyway, back to the hotel..... The staff were, without exception, very kind, offered discounts for internet and valet parking, and responded quickly with extra towels or off-hours cleaning whenever we needed it. The room was well equipped and the bed comfortable. As we were not there for leisure or romance, we did not check out any of the other amenities so cannot comment on these. But I would recommend this hotel. If we had to pay for valet parking, I would have self-parked, as it seemed expensive, esp. if one tips, which i do. Internet also was a cost (so many hotels offer it for free now, I am always surprised at a charge) but not to us as patients.....this was great. I did not use it much, except to send updates to friends and family and it would have been expensive to send a few emails out over the week we were there. I would recommend it.........

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: DJErnDawg
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this hotel in July 2009, and I have to say when I pulled up the place I knew that this was place was going to treat me well and they did. The hotel room was amazing, the service was unbelievable, and most importantly the wi-fi was fast! It's a bit pricey, but I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, does the job and a great night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: mariposa05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights en route to LV. Can't fault the front desk lady who went out of he'd way to organise us a tour of the main sights within an hour of our arrival as we running to a tight schedule. The rooms were clean and comfortable but the bathroom possibly slightly dated. Didn't bother me as I wasn't on holiday in the bathroom! The one and only fault was the location...not the safest if places to walk around after dark and far out of the main tourist hubs.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent service, star rating too high”
Reviews.Author: DPS4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all show and no service. The restaurants were closed "for remodeling" but no workmen to be seen or heard, and open for breakfast! The only food service was the bar and it wasn't that good. We asked for a room service menu three times directly at the check in and was never given one. And we had to ask directly at the desk because anytime we call the hotel (operatior, front desk, etc) no one picked up! Everything was set up so it looked great, but was just for show -- in case we wanted to book the hotel for a wedding! The rooms weren't anything special that a Motel 6 couldn't offer. We had to continually ask about things nearby and were never given a direct answer. The business center has ancient computers and no help. The customer in front of us had been trying to print for over an hour and the staff just shrugged and said they couldn't do anything when she asked for help. We had to print out her stuff from my daughter's laptop which we could plug in, and another customer helped solve the printer issue. Gift shop was overpriced with very little useful items but a lot of jewelry and clothing plus a hovering saleslady who followed you everywhere and tried to upsell. However, if you had to pay for something, they are all over you. Driving up they almost push you out of the drivers seat to valet park your car. Paying for your room is not a problem or checking in with a credit card is not a probelm - its the only thing the front desk will do! When I checked out I complained and the clerk said "I'm so sorry!" then picked up my receipt from the printer, handed it to me and said "So how was your stay?" She wasn't even listening!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay and we would definitely come back for future visits in LA.”
Reviews.Author: H1r0d
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really clean. The beds were amazingly comfortable, which made it hard to wake up and get off on in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was clean and inviting, and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable of the area.”
Reviews.Author: dgardiner81
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay in L.A. this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifeline!”
Reviews.Author: L0U83
Reviews.Content: My review is a little late but myself and a friend won a competition to attend the Oscars in LA , we are from north east England. As part of the prize package we stayed here for 4 nights and found it wonderful. It is a large hotel, and very impressive in splendour albeit a little dated. Room was a good size two double beds and flat screen, mini bar, fridge. We had a ball as you might expect. We were pretty high up so the view was immense, and we enjoyed walking around the neighbourhood, taxi was 15mins to Hollywood and we even got the bus to Santa Monica one day! Food at the hotel was lovely and so much selection, all the staff were very polite and chatty to us and made us feel quite at home. Trip off a lifeline! X

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby and gardens, comfortable bed, outdated bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: kodiak64
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms were small, comfortable bed, but bathroom and technology need an upgrade. Charged for wireless for each device

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, just dont get the breakfast delivered to your room.”
Reviews.Author: RyanSB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and clean. The staff was great. The location and view were great. I did have one complaint though: There was a card that you could fill out and place on the outside of the door if you wanted breakfast delivered to your room in the morning. I chose an option that came with 2 eggs, an English muffin, hash browns, 3 links of sausage, milk, and orange juice for $13. A restaurant would probably charge $7-10 for the meal, but It's a hotel so they are going to price gouge a little bit and I was okay with it. However, when the food arrived I was shocked to see that there was an unmentioned delivery fee and another fee i can't remember the name of, plus tax that brought the total for the breakfast to over $20. What a complete ripoff. That afternoon I walked to a nearby store and bought my breakfast for the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the lack of communication”
Reviews.Author: AnnaDLondon_England
Reviews.Content: If you're a guest looking for a nice hotel, then this is a great place in terms of the quality of the sleeping rooms, friendly and helpful staff in the hotel's main restaurant, and a fabulous location with a great selection of restaurants all within a few minutes walk. The upper rooms also have spectacular views over Los Angeles. If you're looking at using the conferencing facilities, then read on about my experience: A colleague and I ran a 3-day event at this hotel for 60 people. We picked the hotel because of its location in downtown L.A. and because it had the space we wanted at a good price. On the upside, the conference rooms were well-appointed and furnished, and four of them - their "Four Seasons" rooms had sliding doors which allowed quick and efficient changes to size for maximum flexibility, converting it to one, two, three or four rooms as needed. All the rooms we were using were adjacent, allowing people to quickly move from on to another as needed, and all rooms were close to the sleeping rooms - so no great long hikes down endless corridors to get anywhere. The event management staff gave us a great overall rate on a combination of the conference rooms/food and beverage/minimum number of sleep nights booked by attendees. They also gave us a discounted rate for parking. There was good email communication in the 9 months lead up to the event and the staff we dealt with were helpful. On the night before the event, the gave us both access to the rooms and allowed us to set up a registration desk in the lobby area. On the downside, there were a number of problems which left our events running less smoothly than we were comfortable with. Something seemed to happen between what they promised us and what we got. There was an apparent breakdown in communication between the person we were liaising with and the banqueting staff - i.e. the people looking after our conference rooms - which caused a lot of undue stress. On our first day, with one day's notice, we were told we wouldn't be able to use the nearest restrooms as another event had roped the area off. This forced our attendees, including disabled people in wheelchairs, to have to go to facilities on other floors, causing delays in events while we waited for them all to go and get back. The evening of that day, an expensive, specially-made cake for our event (that the hotel had agreed we could bring in) went AWOL after they'd offered to store it for us, never to be seen again. On our second day, we arrived first thing to find the rooms locked and after taking 20 minutes to get someone to open them, they and hadn't been cleaned from the previous day. On our third day, the area outside our rooms was swamped with people for two hours waiting to get into an event in the nearby ballroom - with those guests wandering into our conference rooms until we posted people on the doors to stop them. Throughout our time there, tea and coffee was consistently left outside one of the rooms we were using, rather inside as we requested, so that other random guests kept helping themselves (and at $75 a gallon for coffee, including taxes and service charges, as a not-for-profit organization, we weren't happy about that). Many of the attendees to our event also complained to us about the counter staff being unhelpful and rude, and overall, there was a general lack of organization. We did get a call from the general manager following our feedback. He apologized and told us it won't happen again if we go back there, but didn't offer to reduce the charge on our overall bill or seek in any way to make amends, which left us feeling there was little sincerity behind it. It's a shame because this hotel could be a great all round venue if they could just get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Yoku dekimashita! Wonderful stay...great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: heuster
Reviews.Content: We tried to leave the country this summer, but the universe wanted us to stay in California. So we thought we'd play tourist in Los Angeles...one of the most culturally diverse cities in the country. After reading reviews and looking at the best rated hotels on TA, some had their pluses and minuses. I found the Kyoto on discoverLosAngeles.com, and then read some of the reviews on TA. The pictures on their website reminded me of the Hotel Nikko in San Francisco. I did want to travel to Japan this summer, but staying in Japantown would have to suffice. Their website had a summer special, $199 per night included self-parking, WiFi, buffet breakfast, and chilled sake in the evening, delivered to your room (we only did this one night because we forgot). After looking at several other properties in the area, this was by far the best deal. I booked the room through their website and received a confirmation via e-mail. I wrote back and wanted to make sure they had my requests for a higher floor and a room away from the elevators and ice machine. Everything at check-in was in order. The young woman who checked us in was professional and friendly.
