She gave us a map of the area, and when she forgot to give us the breakfast coupons, she flagged us down when we returned to the hotel later that evening after coming back from the Griffith Observatory. She also recommended a Japanese restaurant, Fuga, which turned out to be a great find! I'm sorry to say I didn't get her name. She is a great asset to the hotel. We ate breakfast every morning and the staff was wonderful. The restaurant also serves Starbucks coffee which not only gets you going, but tastes great too. I can understand why at times, the Pangea Garden is closed for events. It's beautiful, serene, and peaceful. We saw two weddings from our room on the 14th floor. My only regret is not taking more pictures of it. Our room was a good size with two double beds, flat screen t.v., and a small refrigerator which was a nice surprise. I could sleep in that bed all day..it was very comfortable. If I had any concerns, I'd say the bathroom was a little small and there were a few minor little upkeep things, but nothing major to complain about. After reading some of the other negative reviews, I tend to question their veracity. I never book through third parties because you get what THEY give you and there's no compromise with the hotel because you didn't book the room through the hotel. You are just looking for a cheap place to stay and you get what you get. The hotel is location is fine. We walked around at 10 pm and it reminded us a little like San Francisco. Every staff member we spoke to was professional and cordial. The front desk is efficient. It's the customers that make their jobs difficult. When I checked out, I stood in line for about 10 minutes, but all it took was 2 minutes for me to review my bill, say how much I liked their property, and went on my way. Overall, the Kyoto was a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: diablo_cat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for a couple of nights while on business travel. My room was on the 20th floor. The room was small with very unique Asian influence decor. The view from my room wasn't great - but to compensate, the hotel install rice paper rolling window coverings that were really cool. Made you feel like you were in another world. The room was clean and had everything I needed for a quick business trip. Only minor issue was located near the elevator so the sound of the elevator going up and down in the elevator shaft was pretty clear all night - did not impact my sleep but would have killed my husband had he been on the trip with me. Staff at the hotel were really friendly and helpful. As part of the business rate, they threw in coupons for free happy hour appetizers and a free breakfast buffet. I skipped the appetizers but the breakfast buffet was fantastic and opened at 6 a.m. which was useful since I had early meetings. Only a few blocks from Little Tokyo. I felt safe walking over there in the early evening to grab an inexpensive tasty meal. Well located for downtown business as well.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but at the wrong end of town!”
Reviews.Author: HTaylor13
Reviews.Content: The service by the staff was amazing. Very welcoming and helpful. Carly at the Front Desk was the greatest as was Jose the Concierge. The room was beautifully decorated, very clean and well maintained and a small refrigerator was provided which was fantastic. Alleviates exorbatant mini bar prices, so you can buy your own water etc. The location was Down Town near Little Tokyo. It was a little too far from the action and there is no way I would walk around the area at night. The amenities were great and they provide free internet access for guests. I thing I liked best was the overall presentation of the hotel and the staff and service was exceptional. FYI, they have a Starbucks on site. The thing I liked least was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel..but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: mel1711
Reviews.Content: Awesome lobby, really nice bar, room was spacious, comfy bed & nice bathroom. Nicely decorated & definitely clean. Starbucks next door for your coffee & free wifi fix. The location isn't the best, not really anything to see in the immediate area & not a lot of places to choose to eat from, though a couple blocks away are some really awesome asian places, but nothing fancy. Public transport is a 15 min walk. Hotel staff are really friendly & helpful, probably some of the most helpful to date. Definitely a nice hotel if only the location was a little better..

Reviews.Title: “False advertising!”
Reviews.Author: Bitter24
Reviews.Content: Booked this place through hotwire and specifically asked for at least 3 1/2 star or better hotels. Kyoto is rated 3 1/2 and claims the rooms are recently renovated. Apparently only rooms on 14 and above have been renovated and all floors below are crap! It's like staying at Motel 6. We were given a room on the 10th floor and it's old and dated. The bathroom is tiny and the bed is uncomfortable. This hotel sucks! Be warned-if u book the hotel through a third party, you will have a room on the crappy floors! Do not stay at the Kyoto unless you know you'll be staying on the higher level floors. WTF?

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were good”
Reviews.Author: Karina01
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights. We were part of a tour group which spent 3 days in LA. Our room was spacious and well designed. I found the area around the hotel to feel a little on the unsafe side. The staff were very nice and helpful. We liked that there was a train station close by that got us to the main parts of LA without any hassle.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Ninibean
Reviews.Content: First of all, our check in was at 3:00 pm and our room was not ready. In this world of electronics, we could not find an outlet that worked to charge our cell phones and digital camera. The lamp in the room worked intermittently. The TV had a bad picture that needs to be switched out for a flat screen TV. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EkiraN
Reviews.Content: I came here with my family on the 2nd and it was really great. The staff were very friendly and helpful, giving you tips and all that. The room was huge, 4 of us could fit in one room. And we're all considered adults.. (we're asians by the way) The bed was really big, we had the asian room. If im not mistaken, the bed was a california king bed. The hotel is located at downtown and is literally right smack in Little Tokyo, and minutes away from the fashion district. Overall, i wouldn't mind coming back to this hotel if i were going to Downtown L.A. Just a tip, if you were to be going back and fourth to hollywood and bev. hills and you were to be taking a cab, i would suggest renting a car or getting a hotel in that area, its pretty far and the cabs are really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “!!!Very Disapointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Silvercharm21
Reviews.Content: We booked the Kyoto Grand based on the reputation it had for entertainment and fine dining. We were there on a Saturday in July and all that is advertised on the web site was not available. The reservationist (Diane) assured us all the amenities (Sky Bar, Sushi Restaurant) were available to us. As it turned out, it was a straight lie. The Sky bar at the top of the facility was not available as well as the Sushi Bar. We were told it was closed for over two years. This was not relayed to us at the time of reservation. The garden was there, however, unavailable to guest due to the numerous weddings taking place. Again, this was not relayed at the time of reservation. We were told parking was $18 per day. Well, it was $24 a day. Again this was relayed to us in error at the time of the reservation. Not to mention the ice maker on our floor was inoperable so we had to go down two floors to get ice. If this is indicative of the type of service then I would recommend staying elsewhere. Possibly a Motel 6. At least it is cheaper, you will get the same service for less and at least they leave the light on. My recommendation would be to by-pass this hotel and their empty promises and save your money. Signed, Dissapointed & Digusted

Reviews.Title: “Best-kept Secret in LA! Super Front Desk service!”
Reviews.Author: SmartConsumer
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only has an *interestingly delightful aroma* throughout the hotel (great for people who appreciate aromatheray!) but also provides one of the BEST FRONT DESK service in North America, no doubt!!! I found them to be courteous, extremely efficient, professional, discreet and incredibly well trained. Kudos to the Front Desk Management Team for delivering a very caring service to the "guests". Every competitor should send their 'mystery trainee' like a mystery shopper to see what these folks deliver. The hotel location also can't be beat. It's in the heart of Pedestrian-friendly Japan Town section of LA. There're many restaurants, bistros and cafes to stroll around as well as the small Japanese village where there's a small market. Plus, there're many other non-franchised, self proprietor shops dotted around both sides of the hotel streets to browse. Everyday, we walked around the hotel blocks for dining and shopping. If I return to LA, I'll stay here again. It's close enough to many in-town venues but slightly away enough to feel very safe and to enjoy serenity.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pan_1231
Reviews.Content: This hotel had amazing people working always very kind and helpful rooms were very nice and fir a good price. I will be staying here again thank you for an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: TheDebsters
Reviews.Content: The staff was quite attentive. I must point out Maria on front desk, Chris on phones, Eswin, Jacob, and Juan on bellhop/shuttle drivers, as well as Saul in the dining room and a white-haired gentleman whose name I, unfortunately, did not get (in the restaurant as well). The only downside was during the weekend; the restaurant was closed to the guests due to a large affair. Although I could have ordered room service or eaten at the bar, a notice would have been appropriate. Other than that - a very nice stay and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great garden but no extras”
Reviews.Author: mia0003
Reviews.Content: Moe the bartender was awesome. He definitely made our night! He was funny gave us great food recommendations! Hotel, room, and gardens are beautiful. Overall great price for the location, it just doesn't go above to offer the little extras that make the stay. The negative Huge flat screen Tv didn't work and was a a non intuitive weird system. Alarm/radio clock didn't work either. Wifi not included and is 10 dollars a day PER device and doesn't connect properly when in the lobby. 2 dollars per 15 min in lobby???

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in LA - Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhotoGal36
Reviews.Content: It was such a nice experience to stay here. We've stayed at many hotels in CA as well as NV and in Los Angeles this was the best one yet. It was clean, staff was great, easy to locate everything, close to LA Live and Staples. We just fell in love with this hotel. Have been passing along the info for other friends and family wanting to stay in LA. We will come again that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel but its in a horrible area”
Reviews.Author: milanovictraveller
Reviews.Content: I stay here in early 2010, I was recommened this hotel by the tour company. The rooms, bathroom and view are great. But be prepared to look over downtown area of LA, the cop station. The restrunt is great for breakfast, recommend the buffet. I arrived super early kbut they were happy to let have a room. They helped me with how to get froom to a to b. There is free net but be prepared to wait as there is only three computers. The staff are friendy and helpful. Through housekeeping did keep knocking to come into clean even though it was 8am in the morning. There are some good restrunts around to eat at but don't be around after night as there are some scary people around!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: angel_esq
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a few nights for a friends wedding. The hotel and the room had a great ambiance. The rooms were a little smaller than I expected, but the decor and BIG flat screen TV made up for it. Good breakfast in their restaurant. Plus it had a Starbucks attached! Parking was a little pricey. Staff was OK and they offer a shuttle service during certain times down to the Staples center area! That came in handy at nights when we wanted to eat, shop, drink, etc. If I were in that area of LA again, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you're downtown.”
Reviews.Author: bythemoon
Reviews.Content: This is an "old-style" grand hotel with a huge lobby, a few shops on the premises, and a lovely Japanese garden. The only restaurant that seemed to be open while I was there was the combination restaurant/bar in the lobby, which serves sandwiches, salads, etc. The staff was pleasant and very helpful, and there is a shuttle to take you to numerous downtown sights (you can get to L.A. Live, for example). I also enjoyed walking to many of the sights; downtown L.A. appears to be undergoing something of a renaissance, and there was a lot of street life along with many cafes and restaurants to explore. While the decor of the hotel is a little old-fashioned, my stay was comfortable and pleasant. I loved the proximity of the Starbucks right around the corner, and the boutique off the lobby came in handy when I needed to buy a raincoat. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK room, so-so service.”
Reviews.Author: CineGraphic
Reviews.Content: At check-in they tried to assign me a regular room even though my reservation was for a "deluxe". The breakfast buffet was $18+, so I ordered off of the menu, big mistake. Rubbery over-easy eggs, never saw waiter again...no water, no refill of my drink, no one checked to see if everything was ok, they were simply too busy cleaning up to wait on customers. I even left a note about the lack of service on my guest check, yet never heard from anyone. I ate all other meals off-property due to their lack of concern. Keycard had to be replaced/reprogrammed more than once. I eventually ended up carrying 2 keycards with me to save me from any more trips to the front desk. Location is convenient, downtown is becoming quite popular again. I never saw the free shuttle van, and when I asked how to get to the train station, I was told that I could walk, no mention of a shuttle at all. Nice walk, although hot. None of the street people bothered me. I had to call security at 3 in the morning due to a several suites full of drunken sorority girls running amuck.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay but way outside the city.”
Reviews.Author: ashutoshgopal
Reviews.Content: A small but nice quite hotel. Good for a quite and solitary stay. Its in the Industrial part of the city way outside the happening parts. Surrounded by the chinese/japanese neighbourhood. At least 20-25 drive to the city.hollywood. Night life is not happening in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for day trip to Little Tokyo and Garment District”
Reviews.Author: MikerWSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 14th floor overlooking garden. The room was pleasant but there was a wedding event and you can hear the music and the loud DJ even from the 14th floor. Those windows need to be updated. Conveniently located in Littel Tokyo with plenty of restaurants and shops and aproximately 6 blocks of walking to the garment district. Its an urban area with homeless people (downtown Los Angeles) so be prepared. We got a great rate for $129/night which included two breakfast buffets and free self parking. Parking I believe is $30 and buffet is $20/pp which I didn't think was all that great. Just standard breakfast fare except for the miso soup. Pros: - great downtown location for Little Tokyo, Garment District - Clean room - Big TV Cons - Noise from below - Weak shower head - expensive parking

Reviews.Title: “A lot of small things really do add up...”
Reviews.Author: esims04
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Kyoto Grand Hotel and Gardens because it was different from most hotels in the area. The hotel lobby and bar was pleasant and elegant but looked a bit run down and dated. We asked to be upgraded to a suite, the first thing they said was "we do not recommend the suites" a very interesting statement since most hotels would love for all guest to upgrade and pay more. They claimed their suites were not renovated but we did not mind. The first suite had two queen beds so we switched into a "Japanese "style suite, and it was literally a Japanese style, there was no bed and you had to make it and sleep on the floor. We are typical Americans and just wanted a bed big and flat screen to relax in. The third room was the room I booked online called the Deluxe King Room. It was very nice and updated. We were the second room from the elevator, and we were able to hear the elevator go up and down. This was not extremely loud, but enough to notice. We brushed it off and decided to order room service. To our surprise there FEES for just ordering room service! About 15 dollars in fees when we could of just went down stairs and ate; there was no indication about the fees on the menu for room service. We decided to let it go and the next day to eat breakfast and check out. We had booked the Penny Sale which included free Wi-Fi, free breakfast and free parking. Well, when we went to breakfast the waiter told us we needed vouchers. So not a problem, went to the front desk to get the voucher and came back. The waiter then said, you need two vouchers for the both of you. I was a littler irradiated since I book the room for two people but the waiter was kind enough to call the front desk and fix it. After breakfast we go to check out, our bill had two charged of internet and somehowâ€¦our room rate went up from the time I booked it! I look at the front desk lady and say "Internet it free with the deal, please fix it" she fixes it, brings me back to look at it, only one of the charges are gone. I tell her again "There is still a charge for internet, please fix it." She apologizes and fixes it again. The last time I look at the bill my room rate which I booked at $147 went up to $160. I said this is not the rate I booked and thank God I had my reservation printed out from when I booked it. It clearly said $147. She said "Thatâ€™s weird" and fixed it for me. All these little things do add up and made the experience annoying and unpleasant. The staff is incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Walt Disney Concert Hall in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: 4tomorrow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on the 18th floor and had a wonderful view of the city from our lovely room. The linens are first class, and the hotel looks brand new. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I recommend this hotel for anyone visiting downtown Los Angeles. It's a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: MrK65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had such a pleasant experience right from the beginning to the end of our one night stay. The staff was so helpful and friendly. We were very impressed by the staff and how they all were so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff did not advise of all the charges”
Reviews.Author: TwoLippy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to the proximity of my employer, I booked online. I had trouble finding the parking fee, I finally found it in the itinerary after I booked. When I arrived and checked in, I noticed an extra $50.00 charge on my online banking. I called the front desk to inquire and was told it was an "Ammenities Charge" because I used my debit card to book the room. I was a bit upset at this and when I pressed further the desk clerk said "All the other hotels charge it as well and it should drop off in 3-4 days" I am really frusterated that I was not informed beforehand. With Parking, $10.00 per night internet fee and their "Amenities Deposit" my bill was $300.99 for a "Deluxe Room" I heard sirens all night as well as helicopters circling, This hotel is not soundproof by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Kirthi123
Reviews.Content: We had no service at all. If we wanted room service or help, the staff were just not willing to help. Except for reception none of the staff were helpful at all. This was the case inspite of giving tips. The experience was really frustrating. Even the breakfast was provided to only 2 adults inspite of the fact that we had a kid with us. We had to pay full price on the breakfast for our 10 year old kid. For the same price, I am sure there are plenty of other better hotels. I would never recommend this to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “asian”
Reviews.Author: kygregor
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel due to location and price to dodger stadium... Having traveled to korea before this is very similar atmosphere with an american update.. it is very close to the asian parts of LA , so if either you or the person you are going with has even the slightest bit of bigotry i would not advise it... Its a nice place and if you are looking for some good sushi i say go... I would go back if the price is right all in all i would give it 3.5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Smerbp
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very attractive. Staff at the front desk as well as bellmen were exceedingly friendly and helpful on the multiple occasions I requested assistance or recommendations. Room was nicely appointed, but shower could be updated. Would expect a curved shower rod and better shower head at this price point. But the bed, linens and in particular, the pillows were outstanding. A wonderful nights sleep with little to no sound disturbances.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely gardens outside, but unfortunate inattention to environmental values.”
Reviews.Author: georgehanson
Reviews.Content: The gardens are lovely. I was disappointed by the lack of attention to environmental protection. The fan in the bathroom of my room, 2105, ran constantly. Not having been in other guest rooms, I don't know if the control to turn the fan on and off with the bathroom light was broken, or whether this was a norm. The shower has no volume control so it wastes a great deal of water. Worst of all are the single pane windows. They are very energy inefficient and allow a remarkable amount of street noise. Emergency sirens passing by on the street were astonishingly loud. All the windows in the Empire State Building are being replaced because replacing them will save so much energy that the savings will pay back the investment in the windows in around 3-4 years. http://www.seriouswindows.com/commercial-project-gallery/commercial-buildings/empire-state-building.html http://plasticsnews.com/blog/2010/03/big_replacement_window_project.html http://blog.seriousmaterials.com/?p=1078 The Kyoto Grand could dramatically improve its guest comfort and save money in the long-term with energy efficient upgrades, starting with the windows. When your air conditioning system needs to be replaced, it can be downsized significantly due to high performance windows and more efficient lighting, which throws off less heat

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - still more work required for upgrades”
Reviews.Author: pentangle
Reviews.Content: No major complaints. Clean public spaces and very friendly and accomadating staff. Excellent breakfast buffet. Pleasant room but with all the effort to upgrade the room they have ignored the bathroom. Stained caulking and cracked toliet and sink. You are charged for the in room wireless but it is then deducted from the invoice on check-out. I'd stay here again, and given it's location to where I will be working, have planned to do so,

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: easygoingA10
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. The staff were genuinely friendly and responsive. The front desk gave a great suggestion for a Japanese restaurant around the corner. The rooms were well- appointed and comfortable. The only down side was that they had painted the doors on my floor - which left an annoying and potentially noxious smell. I was able to stuff a towel under the door to sleep odor free.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice venue, incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: MaryJack2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kyoto Grand for a four day weekend in April. Our son and his fiancee booked their wedding to be held in the rooftop garden of the hotel. The weekend was great. The garden setting was very nice, marred only slightly by uncontrollable sounds of the city (sirens, traffic, etc.). Throughout the wedding preparations, the post-ceremony cocktails, the dinner and helping move things in and out of the hotel our time there was made better by the responsiveness and helpfulness of the staff. We heard some comments from others attending the wedding about room air conditioners not working as expected but other than that, the rooms were well-kept if a little worn. The lobby, bar and other areas of the hotel were more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pixietravel
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the Kyoto Grand, I was greeted by friendly staff. This friendliness and willingness to help me enjoy my stay continued throughout my visit. My room was clean and quiet. The Azalea restaurant offered good food. Highly recommend the breakfast buffet. There is a beautiful outdoor Japanese garden with waterfalls. There I could almost forget that I was in the midst of a noisy city. Only jarring note was music that was louder on one side of the garden. Personally, would have preferred no music or string classical choice that would have blended with the surrounding calm. However, it was still a wonderful place to sit or meander. I generally prefer hotels that allow me to take my 6 lb dog with me. Kyoto doesn't allow pets. However, I was traveling on business so this wasn't a problem on this visit. If you need or want to be in downtown Los Angeless, I would definitely recommend this hotel for its cleanliness and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed with the room we were given for such a nice hotel,”
Reviews.Author: lety1161
Reviews.Content: We were given a room where the air conditioner didn't work, nor did the phone, the room was not worth the price. We were told a tech would come to check but no one came. Will not recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jwalt300
Reviews.Content: The best part of our stay was the service. From the check-in, to room service and the check-out, the service was wonderful. We had the basic room, and it was that - "basic". However, considering the price for other hotels in the area we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, distinctive, great location and value”
Reviews.Author: travelingj0urnalist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here years ago when it was the New Otani and enjoyed it then, and I found the renamed hotel is still a very nice place to stay. I had a refurbished room, which was competitive with upscale rooms at other hotels, but even the non-refurbished rooms were attractive and comfortable. Public areas are elegantly designed and tranquil. The rooftop gardens are spectacular (and one of LA's most popular spots for weddings). Breakfast in Azaleas restaurant was a comprehensive buffet spread including both American and Japanese fare; quality was consistently good or better, presentation of the food was attractive, and the atmosphere of the restaurant was light, sunny and cheerful, especially sitting in the solarium. Staffpeople were courteous, competent, friendly and welcoming. The location might seem less than ideal at first glance, but in reality it can be a bonus, because Little Tokyo is a fascinating place to eat, browse and discover, and there are many other interesting things to see downtown. And from the hotel it's easy to access freeways or major city streets to get to tourist attractions in other parts of the metro LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with spacious rooms, excellent service, and wonderful ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: SA_1976_11
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay in Los Angeles! My room was spacious and warm, and it even had a walk-in closet! Girls, if you travel with the whole kit & caboodle, you can spread it out at the Kyoto Grand Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was one of my best hotel experiences!”
Reviews.Author: Sidra61
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, and the room was very nice and clean. The location was great for finding places within a few bocks including Metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, friendly and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: loribethuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Staff were friendly, and efficient when help was needed. The only complaint is that there is only one restaurant available now so the selection of food on the premises is limited. However, there are a variety of excellent restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is trying to extort $1300 from me for their broken TV”
Reviews.Author: MYHB
Reviews.Content: If I could give no stars, I would. I stayed at the Kyoto Grand for one night. The TV was broken. No big deal -- I basically just checked in, passed out, checked out. Now they have charged me $1300!!!! for THEIR BROKEN TV. I have never taken the time to write a review before, but this is too incredible to not share. DO NOT STAY at this hotel. THEY ARE THIEVES!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience of LA with Kyoto Grand”
Reviews.Author: comoscope
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by the quality of the hotel. Staff of the hotel was very friendly including room service women. Room where we stayed in was great, especially the beds were very suitable to overcome the jet lag influence. It is at the heart of LA and close to many attractions including walt disney concert hall and union station where the metro is avaliable to holywood and many other destinations. if you walk only 5 min to union station, then you can reach Hollywood in 25 minutes. if you would like to experience Japanese culture, little Tokyo is out there. Hotel carries the signs of the japanese culture. Only drawback is that it does not have free high speed internet in the rooms. You have to buy yourself. For me it would be better if they include the breakfast in the price list. You have to pay for the breakfast seperately. They told me that the breakfast tickets could be bought in advance, but at the web page i could not see any information. Overall, i can recommend this nice hotel to other travelers. if i go to LA again, i would definitely stay there again with a breakfast purchase in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a hotel with spa but this wasn't it”
Reviews.Author: Traveler12123
Reviews.Content: We were traveling home from a road trip from vegas & decided to make one final stop in la. I called to book the reservation and asked if they had a spa. The reservationist said yes and I asked again if they had a full service spa with massage & steam and again he said yes. I wanted to make sure because my husband was sore from driving..so that is why I booked this hotel. When checked In & got to the room we looked for a spa menu & there wasn't one. I called down to the concierge and he said there was no spa & they hadn't had one for 2 years. I told him that the reservationist said they did & said sorry we were misinformed & offered to give us a map of the spa down the street. We were deeply disappointed & would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy "Little Tokyo's" 5 star No Name Japanese restaraunts!”
Reviews.Author: snowdogflyer
Reviews.Content: Location is subjective and would not have worked if we had to pay $15 each way to get to and from Convention Center. For us, this is not an issue because Trade Show Organizers planned for this well and arranged Tour Bus Fleet to provide dense service at 8 minute intervals of 1/3 full busses for comfort + commuting!! For LA, the closest hotels were 5 large blocks away from the convention center, so staying close by is not as beneficial for off site private meetings as other trade show venues where the hotels are across the street. The decision to stay at Kyoto Grand came mainly from positive reviews below on this site. We were not dissappointed. If you enjoy Japanese cuisine and service then this is refreshing as there are dozen or more superior Japanese restaraunts on par with best in any US cities. Ok, that is enough for the area. The hotel review, offers very good value at $175 per nite. In room breakfast choice at $20 with gratuity is excellent, compared to $42 with exactly same food a month prior in San Francisco's W Hotel across street from Moscone Center and local SF breakfast at diner of $27.00 + tip. Was delivered on time. Funny though, we had to phone each day to request the door hanging order form. You would think Housekeeping would put fresh ones in the room daily, but I have noted this from most hotels I stay in so this must be some trendy cost saving tip amongst hoteliers? I stayed on 9th floor. Decor was tired and old, but not peeling or faded and everything worked well. The bedding was new. Linens were Crisp, clean and as comfortable as any Sweet Sleeper upper scale bed. Slept great but that also could have been the Sake and long days. Towels were large and very fluffy. Everything was very clean, very! Gardens in the back of the hotel were actually refreshing to look at in the morning against the city scape and made me wonder, "who would engineer that these days with real estate costs being so high?", so this is pleasant bonus and helps put you in a nice, calm state. This is well maintained by the hotel as it should be and is a nice esthetic. I am a gardener so this was a bonus. I would recommend Garden View rooms over city view. The TV was older tube style, but I only watched it briefly, but it makes the decor appear older and not updated. Small change of this would update the room. Hotel's Ibahn wireless service in the room worked perfectly and having cost waved ($9.95) as part of conference booking package was great! Again, barely used it to upload and download few messages so it would have been painful if we had to pay each day. Lobby bar was well provisioned but underwhelming. OK for meeting or quick drink only. I would not choose to invest more time there than this. A dozen Japanese bars compliment Japanese restaraunts nearby. The hotel staff is terrific, from whoever answers the phone, the front desk, door men, bell captains, housekeepers, room service and kitchen staff were terrific! We did not use the hotel restaraunt as I suspect few do, epecially after reading the reviews here. I looked in and it was closed. At best, it did look subdued. If I owned this property, I would re design coffee shop to reflect higher energy and up beat Japanese style, Tokyo contemporary coffee shop with pastries for tea anytime and 18 hour operation for breakfast 6:00 AM to Midnite for Asian, European and East Coast North American travelers. I did notice from ther bus there is a Starbucks in the hotel, but never visited it. I did not visit the health club, but you probably figured that since this review focus is on sleep, drink and food. The showers worked great. Terrific water pressure. In Japan however, I am always amazed at the terrific tubs and showers. These, though very functional in terms of U.S. standards would be considered sub standard in Japan, only and I suppose a bath make over would be too costly. Safes are provided at no charge but this hotel is very secure. There are well dressed, polite and competent security people in the hotel and present. We felt secure and safe. I like a safe so I can leave my laptop in the room. I did not see one and called the front desk and within minutes, they brought one up and I was in business. The service in this hotel is excellent. Finally, we were leaving as the Tsunami hit Japan and saw the saw and felt the deep concern of many guests from Japan and the local shops. Our thoughts and prayers go out to our friends in Japan! Summary: none of the updates I suggest, the decor or bath fixtures or even coffee shop update would make my stay any better and the lack of these 'updates' are subjective and did not make my stay any worse at all. Strong recommendation for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “meh.... this is *not* a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: ekdc
Reviews.Content: So think of a Comfort Inn that was last renovated in 1985. That's what you're going to get with this place. It's ok, but all of the travel sites billed it as a 4-star hotel, which it is clearly not. The rooms are old, the room number signs on the walls have paint chipping off them, and the carpet looks like it has absorbed about 30 years worth of cigarette smoke. When I first checked in, the room smelled so bad that I went to the front desk to ask for a new room. The concierge gave me a quick tour of a couple of rooms. One smelled, and the other was ok and seemed to have been somewhat renovated. Apparently this place has gone through a couple different owners/names and will become a doubletree. Maybe if they gut it, it'll be nice again. Like it probably was in 1985.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: ChelseabluePhoenix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Los Angeles for medical reasons, and our stay at the Kyoto was a very pleasant experience. Your staff were extremely helpful and courteous.The other blessing for me personally was the availability of a complimentary hotel van to take us to the USC Hospital. One minor complaint was the hot faucet in the bathroom in our room (2008) there was a build up of air in the pipes which resulted in water coming out in short hot spurts and then spraying my wife with water.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Quality in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: 408kittycop
Reviews.Content: The good: The hotel itself is a very nice hotel, fabulous lobby and wonderful staff at the front desk and valet. The bartenders and happy hour were also nice and reasonable. I was impressed with the size of the room (2 Queen) and the beds were super comfortable! The hotel is also located in an area easily accessed by the freeway. And, surprisingly the fitness center was not half bad. After spending numerous trips depressed over the sad state of hotel fitness rooms this one was decent. Plenty of room, decent machines and a TV etc. The bad: The room was a little "beat up" - paint chipping, chips off of the furniture etc. It also got a little noisy with the helicopters from LAPD (landing pad is a few blocks away) but I am also a light sleeper. I thought the shower had a super low head and low water pressure. Back to the fitness room: they need new cardio equipment and new free weights - granted they worked they just need an updating. The Ugly: The service at the restaurant for breakfast. ugh! Seriously, there were at least two waiters on both my visits and a minimal amount of people in the resturant however, the service was horrible. We would sit around waiting and waiting and waiting just to place our order. Then wait around forever to be noticed to get the check. As a former waitress myself I dont get it - maybe the waiters were pulling double duty and cooking some eggs in the back as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressive except for the Japanese touch”
Reviews.Author: Nirajkool
Reviews.Content: It is very near to downtown,in fact at the edge of downtown LA,the location is not very impressive considering they claim to be in downtown LA. The Asian/japanese touch is interesting and attracts,otherwise it is a decent hotel with comfortable rooms.. It is neither a downright No-No! nor a OOh -AAh reco.but you can stay and enjoy LA . Reasonably big with friendly staff and interesting decor and lawns. Ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Paid "Deluxe Room" price for Standard Room!”
Reviews.Author: charcoal9943838
Reviews.Content: I reserved a Deluxe Room at the Kyoto Grand Hotel and Gardens (which were closed, by the way). When I arrived, the room looked great, but there was only wifi internet, and I needed a wired connection. I asked for a new room, and the room they gave me was a Standard Room on another floor. More like "sub-standard," actually -- the room had a terrible musty smell, was extremely dark and small, the tap water so awful that I could hardly stand to brush my teeth with it, etc. I went to the front desk and complained that not only was the room of poor quality, but I was also paying the Deluxe Room price for it! I asked them to adjust the rate to reflect the room type, but they told me they were unable to do so. Baloney! "Unable" = "unwilling." I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in central location with panoramic city views”
Reviews.Author: Flyingaroundtheglobe
Reviews.Content: We had a great, spacious room in this hotel with great, panoramic views over LA. The room was clear and the bed very comfortable. The location in downtown is very convenient, especially if you do not have a car. Metro stations and LA's main train station are within walking distance. Moreover you can walk to the Disney Concert Hall within ten minutes. We felt safe in the area even at night. The rate was very reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms aren't as impressive as lobby. Service, however, is very good!”
Reviews.Author: iherrera84
Reviews.Content: Shuttle service is very convenient. The garden in the hotel is charming as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: MLes45
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was incredibly accommodating. They made it so easy to get to where I needed to be (shuttle service is great!), and the entire staff was very friendly and helpful. They really looked out for me. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not come back to this hotel since there are so many other great choices in LA”
Reviews.Author: HappyToGo1
Reviews.Content: This is a tired, old hotel that marginally works if you are a low-budget traveler. It is really not suited for business travelers or people interested in seeing the "better side" of LA. The front desk people are friendly but they get a lot of tour buses at this hotel, hence very long lines to check in/out or to ask questions. Rooms are dressed up to seem OK but when you really look, the place is old with old amenities. Fitness center is not a center but a small room that is musty, very small and no windows--not a place you want to spend any time in.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nothing like what they show online.”
Reviews.Author: rhill087
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Koyoto Hotel for a basketball game and made reservations for the Kyoto Hotel. We checked out a bunch of hotels before making the reservation and did our research. After checking out the hotels the Kyoto was the hotel we wanted to stay in. It caught our eye with the decor of the rooms. We checked in the hotel and got a room on the 5th floor. When we got to our room it was a total suprise to us. The room looked nothing like what was shown online. We got a corner room so it was smaller than normal and the bathrooms were really tiny. We went to bed that night and the beds were not comfortable at all. Yes, the service at the front desk and valet was amazing, and the outside garden was beautiful but rooms were very disappointing. Overall we would stay here again but get a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff attitude. Rooms a bit shabby.”
Reviews.Author: hmhalff
Reviews.Content: The staff here is most attentive: doormen, bellhops and reception clerks. The rooms need a makeover. Too few power outlets, plumbing that behaves in odd ways. Coffee makers that are not consistently serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again....but on floors 14-20”
Reviews.Author: JoJoStateWorker
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, you kind of rely on internet searches for your hotel choice. So I was dazzled by Kyoto's website and pics. Im a State worker and they complied with the State Rate of 110 a night and were kind enough to roll internet and parking into that. WHAT A DEAL!! I called up there at noon and checked in early as they had a room available....on the 21st (top) floor. I was let down when I opened the door. No gleaming white bed covers and red accents. All was done in pale blonde wood colors and pastels yuck. BUT I was in a deluxe room (size wise) and I felt safe. Nice underground garage with in and out priviliges. Great lobster bisque! Breakfast was damn good. I came in around 11 one night and the bartender was able to get me some food. They didnt have to go containers so he walked me up to my room. I asked about the decor and he let me know that floors 14-20 were renovated and looked like what the site offered. Check in and out was a breeze. Close to freeways! Very quiet, very peaceful, satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “"Chilling at the Kyoto"”
Reviews.Author: jennkari0719
Reviews.Content: I booked a chilling at the Kyoto package.. which included parking and breakfast. The only place i've stayed at in downtown LA is the Sheraton... and compared to the Sheraton, i will be staying here again. although the bathrooms were smaller.. the towels were full and fluffy. breakfast was yummie. rooms in general were smaller... but for the $$ paid, i'd stay here again. it is near a police station... but then again, anywhere downtown can be noisy if you're a light sleeper

Reviews.Title: “Good service but not a value oriented option”
Reviews.Author: mkoiki
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to LA area and I didn't have a clue about the most convenient place to stay so I followed a friend's recommendation to be in downtown area. Later, I learned that it was a convenient option to him (as we would meet in one opportunity) and not that convenient to my personal purposes, but whatever, it was not a problem at all. The hotel is located in Little Tokyo, where you will be able to find a good variety of Japanese restaurants, a Japanese market (that actually sells non-Japanese stuff as well), Japanese-style "combinis" (convenience stores), Japanese DVD rental and so on. You will find non-Japanese establishments as well, just to be fair. The area seems reasonably safe given what I have heard of downtown LA. Summarizing, this is my take on Kyoto Grand Hotel: Pros * Friendly staff * Good restaurant options at a walking distance (mainly if you like Japanese food) * Loved my two double beds! :) Cons * You may be able to find better value options if you look further than I did * It is not exactly a con, but you can feel that the hotel is well prepared to serve Japanese customers needs but not necessarily your particular needs

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and you pay for every amenity. Only stay here if traveling from Japan”
Reviews.Author: ryanleepeters
Reviews.Content: We got the room through a discount site. We have had good luck with 3.5 stars in the past getting the best of discount with clean and nice staff and rooms. This is not typical of a 3.5 star hotel. While the lobby has some designer touches, the rooms where it is more important, had been neglected. The carpet literally had torn away from the carpet strips. My wife even got stabbed a couple times on the transition between bathroom and room. The tile was from the 70's in the bathroom and had broken and failing grout. So much to the point that the soap dish was pulling away from the wall. It was pretty gross and had unprofessional repairs. Pay 24 dollars a night for self parking and 9 dollars for three hours of wifi. The cable is bad quality and felt the springs in the bed. The japanese garden was poor and the only redeeming factor would be the services to Japanese speaking patrons. This included translotors and yen conversion. To bad I didn't just arrive from Japan. To make things worse we thought we save alittle sense they had no breakfast outside of 13 dollar per plate room service by keeping some groceries in the fridge. We woke up with everything in the fridge warm even though it was on and making noise. Just nothing could redeem this experience.

Reviews.Title: “For the price and downtown location it was great”
Reviews.Author: JasonDPT99
Reviews.Content: For those of you complaining about parking fees just accept the fact that downtown Cities with limited parking i.e. LA, SF etc...,sot hotels charge for parking. The room we got was a deluxe and had the flat screen tv so can't speak about the old rooms the others stayed in, the room looked newly remodeled and a bit small but beds were new and the room including the bathroom were clean. The best part was the location, in Little Tokyo. We felt very safe walking around little Tokyo as there were many people walking around. There is a new condo complex and a police station half a block away and great ramen, curry, and Japanese restaurants. There's even a Pinkberrys that delivers. We booked it through Hotwire so didn't actually choose the hotel but plan to go back to the same hotel for our next seminar in March. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smell like cowhouse”
Reviews.Author: and7ey
Reviews.Content: Not bad location (if you have car), but this is business downtown, no big shops/clubs around. At the same time, if you have car, the parking at the hotel is very expensive (24$ per 24 hours, which are really not 24 hours, it ends at 3pm next day), and no free parking around the hotel during the day time (nearest 24h parking costs 9$ per day with no possibility to in & out during the day). Internet costs ~$10 per day, but you may use free wi-fi at starbucks cafe located just in the next building (works even overnight when cafe is closed). Also you may use internet at the hotel's business center (free for first 10-15 minutes). But the worst thing about this hotel - rooms smell like cowhouse. Brr...

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good service”
Reviews.Author: Engineer911
Reviews.Content: I work every so often at LAPD and so the Kyoto is perfectly located within one block, making it the best option for me. I've stayed there one or two weeks a year every year since maybe 2005, since it was the New Otani (old name). My take is that the price is very reasonable for downtown (generally @$135/night). This is very important- they have rooms which have been renovated with black wood furniture and new bedding (very comfortable) with large Sharp LCD Tvs but you need to ask for it specifically. The front desk told me they don't charge more, it's just based on availability and upon request. I've had one every time. The only issue I have with these rooms is the bathroom- yes they are pretty small, but more annoying to me is the vanity/sink. I'm tall so any hotels with older lower sinks are annoyance when shaving and such. Newer hotels generally have counter height sinks which are much nicer. But that's my only issue with the room. Room service is terrific, it's a bit overpriced (only because of the service charge) but is tasty and I don't think it's ever taken more than 15-20 mins from order to delivery. Staff is very friendly. They have 24 hour maintenance staff and they were able to quickly accommodate my request to make my room's AC very cold despite it being cold outside and 2am at the time. Another important tidbit is that there is a free shuttle which will take you (and come get you) most places downtown. I've been taking cabs everywhere and never even knew that til this trip. Ramon at the bell desk clued me in on it and was awesome, even took me to an ATM for my bank to save me bank fees at just any ATM. Lastly they are probably being bought by Doubletree soon which is all the better since I am a Hilton Diamond member, and earning points would make this hotel all the better. If you have business in that area then I would highly recommend the Kyoto.

Reviews.Title: “In town for Rose Bowl”
Reviews.Author: WrldTvlr82
Reviews.Content: Was in town for the Rose Bowl, looked at several hotels in the Pasadena and Downtown area (Hilton, Westin, etc) and found the Kyoto at a significant discount. For the price it served the purpose, and was VERY close to the rail station. Some decent restaurants are within walking distance as well. While the lobby was nice our hotel room was very dated, i.e. circa 1988 BRASS EVERYWHERE. Also given the price it was a good place for younger people to all chip in for a room, so woke up a couple of nights to loud conversation. The lady who checked us in was very crabby, wish I could remember her name, but others and the porter were very friendly. If other hotels in the area are similar in price (Westin, Hilton, Omni, etc) book them first, however if Kyoto is your only choice or at a good discount it will do.

Reviews.Title: “screwed up my holiday”
Reviews.Author: spikeysingapore
Reviews.Content: Will never return and never recommend this hotel. Rxcept for the bellboy, this place was extremely disappointing. It didnt help that it was new years and that the rose bowl was happening. The rooms are like circa 1980s and they show their age too. service was horrid and maybe thankfully non existent at times.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this hotel are the best.”
Reviews.Author: cairnsaust
Reviews.Content: On this trip we travelled throughout Asia, Canada and the West Coast of the States. The staff at this hotel were the very best we encountered our entire trip. To begin with we were early to check in (plane arrived about 9am) and the staff offered us to either wait for the room we were allocated or check in immediately to a lower floor room. We checked in immediately. The staff helpfulness didn't stop there though - we booked a hop on hop off bus with front office staff, they gave us directions and tips, and the clincher was that they booked us an airport transfer for the same price as a taxi. We thought that the transfer would be a tiny car, but it was a Suburban! We felt very cool arriving to the airport, finishing off our long holiday in a very LA ride!!! The hotel lobby is just gorgeous. The room has been refurbished, however the bathroom could do with a little more work - but was totally functional. The garden was lovely, and we couldn't believe that it existed in downtown LA! The only downside to this hotel is that its location isn't fantastic. It suited us fine as we walked to the fashion district and downtown, but I wouldn't walk anywhere around the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience of PEACE within a very busy metropolis”
Reviews.Author: doctoragloria
Reviews.Content: LOVED the garden on the second level and appreciated the decor of the lobby and public spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the people”
Reviews.Author: wetherhaven
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and with great service. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in the wrong part of town”
Reviews.Author: dreamer2207
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel as part of an organised tours pre departure accomodation package. When i went to check in i was taken pretty much straight away and it was all over pretty quickly. the room was stunning. fantastic double bed,safe, tv, tea/coffee facilities, a fridge, all was very clean. The bed was extremely comfy i certainly didnt have any issues getting to sleep. The area the hotel was in didnt appeal to me at all. I certainly didnt feel safe, even during the day sometimes. There is a starbucks underneath the hotel which ws fantastic and also a japanese supermarket where you can get fresh fruit etc. The restaurant in the hotel was ok, i was the only person in there when i went down to eat so i had no issues about waiting to long or anything. The lady who served me was very pleasant. The hotel have a business centre where they offer free internet which was great and there is also a free shuttle service (although tipping is the payment). I made use of this service to go and see a basketball game at staples centre. Now this is where my complaint about the hotel staff comes in. The gentleman who dropped me off was lovely, gave me a card with the telephone number on it for when i wanted picked back up. So later on i called back for them to come and get me, the guy on the phone said just go back to where you were dropped off, so doing just that i went across the road only to find the road i had been dropped off was now closed to accomodate everyone coming out of the staples centre. so i went to the nearest corner to see if i could see the shuttle coming,luckily i did and he seen me also as i waved at the bus (it was a different man this time) but once i got in the bus he proceeded to give me a tirade of abuse!! saying i should have been more specific about where i wanted picked up. I was FUMING!!! all in all it ws a pretty good hotel, but the staff leave a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “THEIVES”
Reviews.Author: Bilbo88
Reviews.Content: Well, to start off, I spent about 2 weeks visiting los angeles, spent alot on time in hotels and let me tell you this, I HAVE NEVER BEEN SO FRUSTRATED! I went there for a wedding so we stayed the Wednesday night to sunday. Thursday night, the "roof top garden"(which is not on the roof PS) was reserved so we couldnt go admire the view. The restaurant there was SO expensive! The bar closed down very early and the worst part of this hotel is that I had STUFF stolen from my room! I had to call security twice. They told me this woudl be taken care of and to not worry. Before I left the hotel to come back to Canada , I checked in at the front desk to see what progress had been made. She advised me that they will contact me ASAP with some news. I was so disapointed because I had put all my souvenirs in one bag so that i new where it was at all times, and that is the bag that was stolen from my room, thats how i knew right away it was missing! SO i travelled back, didnt hear anything for the first little while. Finaly we got in contact, Took more info, by the end of the conversation my claim had got DENIED becuase they chose to believe the lies of a staff member other then customer! The lies she said did not even make sense. The worst part is that she said she saw the bag and didnt touch it... THE BAG WAS ON MY BED and THE BED SHEETS HAD ALL BEEN CHANGED so how does this make sense? Ruined my Trip. Had no souvenirs for my family or friends. I am not satisfied what so ever. I believe something else could have been done. I will Get my story around to everyone that is thinking of staying here because WATCH OUT they are THEIVES!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why wasn't my room ready?”
Reviews.Author: atxmel
Reviews.Content: I arrived just after the check-in time, and I was told that they didn't have the room that I had reserved ready. They offered me a room with queen beds. I saw some other people, who were in the same boat but had no time to wait, take that deal, but that's not what I wanted, nor was it what I reserved. Instead, I waited while they sent someone upstairs to check the room to see if it was ready, and he reported that it was. Of course, when I went up there, I discovered that it was not ready yet. The housekeeper hadn't even begun cleaning it, and she was mortified to have me there already. Fortunately, I had plans to go meet a friend elsewhere, so I tipped the housekeeper and left my things there while she cleaned, but it gave a very negative impression of the hotel. The rooms are nice enough, although a little rough around the edges in the bathrooms. The bed was very comfortable. The location is very handy to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Brazil_sp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in downtown, near many subway and rail stations, several malls and Walt Disney Concert Hall. Neighborhood looks safe during the day, but a little bit empty at night. Desk front is very kind and helpful. Japanese garden in the restaurant floor is really amazing, relaxing and a good place to hang out or just take a coffee/tea. The room has a good size, but is not to much illuminated. There are only some desk lamps and a roof lamp near closet. Sheet is clean and bed is comfortable, cozy and large. Room amenities include a minibar (but without any provision, just some free coffee), iron and electronic safe. Room service was fare not extraordinary,but generally good. Powerful water jet and easy hot/cold water control in shower which however is protect only by a cheap plastic drape. Parking, breakfast and wifi internet are charged apart (could really increase the daily bill). Donâ€™t know about band speed since I actually didnâ€™t use it. An old tube TV has few channels. Place was quite and guests were mostly asian polite people. Not a fancy place, but general hotel atmosphere is really good, with japanese theme furniture in the room and in the lobby, some gift stores and a tour desk in the small business center (where there is free internet and a printer that I actually didnâ€™t use). Starbucks is just by the corner. PROS: really comfortable bed, great location in downtown, amazing and relaxing garden in rooftop CONS: no free wifi, breakfast not included, weak room illumination, old tube TV (limited channel options)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LJS007
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by the accomodations at the Kyoto Grand. Typically when a website shows gorgeous pictures of the accomodations, I tend to be disappointed when I arrive,.. Not so with the Kyoto Grand... the pictures didnt do the hotel justice. The hotel is really a beatiful place, the accomondations are lush and I could I will definitely return to this hotel again. Although I think some of the fixtures (leaky facet) in the bathrooms may need to be updated and or work on, that was really the only thing that I found in need of repair. It was clean, the staff was very friendly and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerABQ66
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Courteous service. Indeed, we arrived early morning on the train and were even allowed into our rooms ahead of time with no charge. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We were there for 24 hours for a wedding. Little Tokyo was very interesting.”
Reviews.Author: megs35
Reviews.Content: Wasn't there long enough to make a real review. Room was very nice but the bathroom needed some work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: subchat
Reviews.Content: We were there for 2 nights in early July 2010. This Hotel is in the financial district and has a lovely Japanese Garden on the 3rd or 4th level which is just amazing. Dont miss it . The view of La city from there is beautiful. Hotel has a huge lobby, great rooms with adequate airon, spacious and comfortable beds. What more can you ask for .It is a no smoking hotel . Excellent buffet breakfast.We did not eat in the restaurants as our tour operator had arranged for our dinner elsewhere but overall ambience of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto trapped in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Crius
Reviews.Content: Downtown LA, mmm, yet if you have to Stay in Downtown Kyoto tries hard and is OK. Downtown is and can be a sad refelection of what LA really has to offer. Chose Kyoto Hotel for a 1 night stop pver and dint want to stay near airport. Having been to LA several times yet never Downtown. Caught Flyaway bus from LAX to union station and hotel shuttle promptly picked us up from Union Station. Front Desk staff were helpful and freindly, Maria suggested options for dinner and gave us directions for various venues near by. Room and furniture was in good condition and clean, yet styled in outdated browns colors, very 70ish. We walked ( during the day ) from Kyoto to Staples cntre and back via theatres. ( Drop in to Disney Theatre and join a tour). Area around hotel is sad ( so much of Downtown is) Homeless are around and after dark Hotel shutlle was happy to drop/ pick up within short distances. If you need to stay Down town for a reasonable price for a reasonable room then Kyoto is OK. If not dont stay Downtown..sorry LA , Downtown is just sad. LA I will be back Downtown not .

Reviews.Title: “A 2.5* quality room”
Reviews.Author: ERvisit
Reviews.Content: I paid $140 to stay one night here. Definitely NOT a 3.5* hotel. On the edge of Little Tokyo and a questionable neighborhood. Expensive parking. The lobby area is nice. The room was substandard. The workout room was dated and much of the equipment inoperable. Helpful front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: boston77girl
Reviews.Content: Got the room on Priceline for $55 and that's what my room is worth. Can hear the buses go by, construction work outside & shower is in dire need of repair.

Reviews.Title: “Stay far away from this place”
Reviews.Author: emoney555
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible, they were having a wedding in the garden with extremely loud music until 10pm on a Sunday. the Manager was very arrogent when we complained about it. You would have thought upon check in with a young child someone could have mentioned that they were going to be playing loud music..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: LocoTravelers
Reviews.Content: Just needed a place to crash for the night. Room was quiet, staff was friendly, beds were hard and the pillows were not very good. But for the money, we would stay again. Clean and relatively comfortable with the exception of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a sketchy location”
Reviews.Author: JY_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: After my visit to Disneyland, I decided to stay for a couple of days in LA. I booked this hotel because it was on sale and because it was considered central. The hotel itself is nice. The common areas were exquisitely decorated in Japanese motif and there are restaurants on site along with a rooftop terrace. We chose to eat in Little Tokyo instead. However, late nighters be warned...the walk from the hotel to Little Tokyo is really sketchy. I would totally not recommend any female walking alone in this area at night to go to Little Tokyo to grab a bite to eat. I stayed in because I wasn't feeling well while my sisters went out for a late dinner. They said they felt extremely uncomfortable and feared for their own personal safety getting back to the hotel. They said they never felt so scared walking on a street at night. For those traveling by car or cab, this place is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: Packerbacker53233
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to have an identity crisis. The decore is oriental, but they have pop music playing in lobby. The beautiful rooftop garden restaurant/bar was closed the 1st night, but most of the staff didn't know it was closed or why. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The fitness center was small, had very old tread mills, the bikes didn't work and the carpet was dirty. The counter staff was less than inviting and the bartenders not very talkative. The one restaurant that was open, had good food and very pleasant employees. Within walking distance of little Tokyo which has alot of shopping and good food.

Reviews.Title: “A/C problems and room smelled like mildew”
Reviews.Author: CbinBigD
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nites this week for a business meeting. The bedding was comfortable, and the rooms were attractive. Room service was good, but very pricey. However, I had to change rooms once because the first room had such an odor (like mildew), I felt like I had a sore throat. The second room was somewhat better. However, the last morning when I got up to shower, there was black sluge covering the bottom of the bathtub, which had apparently come from the air conditioning vent directly over the bath.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mzjimmy
Reviews.Content: It was okay had some inconvieces over the duration of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice and Staff Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JennaMargravePalmer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exceptional and I would definitely stay there again if in Los Angeles. The only thing I had a problem was the uninvited "seranade" when they have a private party every Thursday night where you can hear it in your room. I was on the 17th floor, so if you mention that, they might put you in one of their other lovely rooms. I have been many places as a travel agent, and I would recommend this hotel! You would not even need to rent a car because of its great downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect Downtown LA Trip”
Reviews.Author: plzNoBedBugs
Reviews.Content: Really awesome stay. I've only been to downtown LA twice before, and was skeptic of the neighborhood based on some of the reviews. But I couldn't have been happier with my stay. Hotel overall was great, clean large room for the price with a panoramic view of the area, staff was really helpful, they even provide free shuttles to most areas-I got a free lift to/from LA Live. The neighborhood is awesome, is not sketchy at all, and has some of the best eats in the area! Definitely check out the local food (Daikokuya is where I went) on 1st street and then head towards Weiland Brewery and then end your night at Edison near the Kyoto. We were out late until 2am and were completely safe. To top it all off, the gardens at the Kyoto are a nice point to relax and enjoy. Only complaints I have and why this wasn't a perfect stay was the price of the parking, price of the breakfast buffet, and lack of free internet in the room. the business center has free computer use if you don't mind the shared pc use with all guests.

Reviews.Title: “If you overlook this hotel you short change yourself.”
Reviews.Author: KTH082010
Reviews.Content: My spouse was being treated at USC University Hospital. Being from the mountain west, never having been to L.A. before and being there for stressful reasons I can only say I have never been treated better in any hotel. I was accomodated quickly with any request I made. The staff, from the front desk, to the bellman, to the cleaning team were all friendly and willing to serve. Like me, before our trip, you can read all the various websites and reviews and worry about some of the negative reviews. I can only give you my experience and it was fabulous. Did I get a mint on my pillow..No. Did I get a newspaper at my door every morning..No. Do little things like that matter to me..No. The room was furnished nicely. The room was very clean, comfortable and calming. I never heard the neighboring rooms but once or twice during my almost 2 week stay. None of my concerns from the negative reviews I had read came true. NONE. If I can afford a leisure trip to the downtown L.A. area in the future I wil not look at any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel.....lovely location....good service”
Reviews.Author: Andy300686
Reviews.Content: Ok so this stay was planned, and i had researched the hotel prior to booking..... I booked a trip with a travel partner, and this was to stay here whilst doing a tour of LA. The location is really convenient....close proximity to subway stations and some interesting sights and archetecture of LA city. LA does not have a fantastic transportation system, and its very congested, so use of cabs is advised, but try to agree a price from the hotel prior to entering the cab. All services at the hotel are great, and if you are thinking of using the hotel for marriage purposes, i.e. functions and after parties, then i would advise it, as this happen three times duing my stay, and the service looked fantastic! Rooms are cleaned daily and they are decorated to a modern standard and have all the mod-cons you would expect from a 4 star accommodation in America. Overall, i can not say anything bad about this accommodation, except its worth the money, and i am sure you will have a fantastic time. Good luck!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel - bad area”
Reviews.Author: rehminio
Reviews.Content: Preliminary note: Stay out of downtown Los Angeles if you donÂ´t have to be there. ItÂ´s boring (the only interesting side is the concert hall), loud, dirty and after sunset very spooky and dangerous (some of the few restaurants have security guards...) The Kyoto Grand itself is fine: Very friendly staff, spacious rooms, comportable beds, nice japanese garden and using the internet at the buisness center is free for ten minutes. Con: Parking costs 24 $ per night but in light of the area around the hotel itÂ´s worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service”
Reviews.Author: JoeT834
Reviews.Content: This hotel with a decor that is unique and service above par was a welcome stay during my recent visit. The restaurant served a quality but value priced lunch and the Starbucks was easy to access right off the lobby. The business center did not offer overnight express outgoing service as I expected it would, and the internet connectivity was slow and unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Although the room looked nicely renovated...”
Reviews.Author: speedtraveler3000
Reviews.Content: Although the room looked nicely renovated and the service was friendly, I would probably not return for two reasons: (1) the shower was lukewarm at 8 am on the weekend, and (2) the velvet pillows were smelly. The location is excellent for visiting Little Tokyo and the Geffen, but I prefer a place with hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Almost as good as a weekend in Japan”
Reviews.Author: NStassino
Reviews.Content: The staff, especially the bellmen, were very helpful in arranging transportation for me to the opera and to the train station. I was able to get a free upgrade and a late checkout too. I had not stayed at this hotel for 9 years, and the surrounding area in Little Tokyo is much livelier than I recalled from my last stay. The Japan American museum is worth a visit, with the lovely Chado tea room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Cazzima44
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful! The beds very comfortable. The TV screen huge! The front deck morning staff - Maria, Janet, Kay - were fantastic, helpful and always cheerful. Wendy S at the Azealea Restaurant served me and my friend twice being super nice and providing excellent service. And the woman making up our room (never did get her name) was SO sweet and nice to hold off making up our room until we left for some time. She would always come back. :) The only negative part was no free WiFi. Otherwise all was great.

Reviews.Title: “i would not visit this place again”
Reviews.Author: db5252
Reviews.Content: i chose to stay at the kyoto hotel after visiting a la dodger game. we chose this place not knowing are way around la. they posted they had a sushi bar which is no longer their. they posted they had 3 bars to choose from only to have 2 of the 3 closed to a wedding. the 3rd would close at 11pm. my friends and i were very diapointed that no altercations were made to their guest that were not involed in the wedding. the staff at the lounge bar was very inconsiderit as well. i will never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Provides basics for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: serenity71
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this hotel prior to booking. I made the choice to stay at this hotel because it was the only downtown LA hotel left with a vacancy at the time that I booked, which was several weeks in advance. I knew what to expect after the reviews, but wanted to remain optimistic and open minded. My friends and I were placed in a room that is advertised as a "renovated" room on their website. So the rooms shown in the website photos do in fact exist. Although now, I am wondering what year those photos were taken! The first thing that I noticed when I entered the room was that (as prior reviews stated) the air conditioning did not work. It was basically the fan running. Needless to say, the room temp was about 75 degrees when we arrived mid afternoon and at least 85 when we woke the next morning. We had the wall unit turned down to 60!!! I cannot imagine what these rooms are like when the outside temperatures are even higher. I do have a couple of positive things to say. I was pleased with the customer service. I called a couple of times prior to my stay because I knew the hotel was sold out. I wanted to be sure that there was not a problem with my reservation and I wanted to be first in line to check in.. just in case the hotel overbooked. I spoke with several different people and each person was extremely nice and accomodating. Also, my friends and I came in at 2:00 a.m. and needed to find a restaurant still serving food. The staff immediately recommended a Japanese restaurant a couple blocks away that was still open and the food was excellent!! Another positive that I can add is the shower in the bathroom. The bathrooms in the hotel have not been updated and still have the old 70's pink tile and fixtures. Also, there was no fan to absorb the moisture. With that being said, the shower in our room worked great! The water pressure was 11 on a scale of 10 and we were on the 4th floor! The water was also hot, just how I like it. The shower head was a hand held and also had a tall placement post that worked perfect for a tall person as myself. I didn't have to break my neck trying to wash my hair. So, with this being said, most of the reviews for this place... as of the date of my stay.... are right on.

Reviews.Title: “Too little for too much”
Reviews.Author: Faconner
Reviews.Content: For $300 a night this place was a real disappointment. Everything about the place is mediocre; the room coffee maker never worked even though I left a note every day; the maid did not replace the soap until it was a sliver; there was not a comfortable chair in the room; the wireless network never worked; crummy TV; mediocre overpriced food. The place had a lot of youth tour groups and that seems to be its best use. On the good side, the bed was comfortable and the hotelwas quiet so i slept well, but i would have expected to pay about half what I did. Avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Round two!”
Reviews.Author: hotelhopper702
Reviews.Content: I came to the Kyoto Grand Hotel a few months ago to just escape with my boyfriend. We planned the trip last minute so we were very surprised to find there was still availability. Anxious to get anything confirmed, we booked the reservation. My expectations were very low, being that I work and live in Vegas and thought I had seen all the top notch stuff, but when we arrived, the hotel staff was so polite and they really took interest in our needs. the room itself was much better than I had anticipated and I'm so glad we decided to stay there. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It is a hidden secret...adorable.”
Reviews.Author: sallielouise2
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with beauty all around. This hotel was during renovation in laces but the work did not interfere with the pleasure of the hotel. A real 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Oatsiedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kyoto Grand In April 2010 with a large group and had a great time.
